It has been a hot one. Would you like something to drink?
What do you have?
We have soda, juice, and bottled water.
I'll take bottled water, and my wife would like one, too.
Sounds good. Would you like it in a glass with ice?
Yes, that sounds wonderful.
We also have some slices of pineapple. Would you like some?
Pineapple would hit the spot. I would love some.
Does your wife want some as well?
Actually, she doesn't like pineapple. Thanks, anyway.

title: Ending a Conversation
content: I didn't like the way you sang tonight.
Oh, wow. Well, thanks for coming out.
You didn't put in all your effort. That's all I'm saying.
Okay, well I'm going to leave now.
Why are you in a rush to leave?
Because you are being rude, and I don't want to speak to you.
Well, now I know you can't take criticism.
It's not that I can't take criticism; it's that I don't like jerks.
How am I a jerk? I'm just giving you my honest opinion.
Well, in my honest opinion, I don't care what you think.
Now, that was rude. I don't want to talk to you anymore.
Great. Believe me; I won't be losing any sleep.

title: Leave-taking
content: It's 4 a.m. already? I have to be getting home.
You can stay over if you want. I have an extra bed.
I appreciate the gesture, but I must get home.
Do you want to hang out tomorrow night?
I would love that. I will call you after I get out of work.
What time do you get out?
If my boss isn't there, I should be getting out at around 8:00 p.m.
And if your boss is there?
Then I will be getting out sometime around 10:00 p.m.
Great. We could go grab a drink after you get out of work.
That sounds lovely, good night.
Good night. Drive home safely.

title: Easy or Hard?
content: I don't know which class to register for.
You should pick the class you need.
I know I need a science class.
I would take biology with Mr. Green.
It's a challenging yet fun class.
I don't like challenges.
Why are you in college then?
My mom forced me to enroll.
You should go to a vocational school instead.
I don't think you understand. My mom is scary.
Okay, fine. I recommend Earth Science 125 with Mr. Anderson.
Thanks for the recommendation!

title: A Restriction
content: I am so upset.
Oh, no. Talk to me about it.
I can't register for a class I really need.
Is it full?
I have a hold on my record, because my library books were overdue.
Can't you just pay the overdue fees?
I can't afford it. I'm totally broke.
How much do you need?
I need $50.
Wow, you must have kept those books long past the due date.
Yes, I know I am horrible.
I'll lend you the money.

title: The Quiet Student
content: Hi, I'm James. What's your name?
Hi James. My name is Lisa.
I'm taking this class because it seems interesting. Why are you?
I'm taking this class because it's a requirement.
We should get to know each other.
I don't think so. I like keeping to myself.
So you don't like meeting new students?
Nope. I would rather just be alone.
That is so sad!
It's not. It's really peaceful and self-empowering.
Can we at least study together?
Nope, we can't do that.

title: Finding the Classroom
content: It takes me hours to find my classroom.
I might be able to help you.
Really? That would be great!
What's your classroom number?
My classroom number is A21.
So the "A" is the building type.
Okay, but I don't know where that is.
Do you know where the gym is?
Yeah, I do.
Okay, your classroom is behind the gym.
That's really helpful! Thank you.
No problem, and the "21" means it's upstairs.

title: Buying Textbooks
content: I can't spend anymore money after I buy my English textbook.
How much is your English textbook?
It's $198. I'm not kidding.
That's ridiculously expensive! What's the title of the textbook?
It's called How to Write Well.
Dude, someone is selling that book for $30.
No way. What edition is it?
I think it was the 10th edition.
Oh, no wonder he or she is selling it for only $30.
What edition do you need?
I need the 21st edition.
The publisher seems to be really making money, considering the number of editions.

title: Professor Hernandez
content: I hate Professor Hernandez!
Me too! He keeps calling me stupid!
You think that's bad? He gave me an F, because I double spaced my essay!
But every professor wants essays double spaced. He's crazy!
Professor Hernandez is weird. He wants essays triple spaced.
That's just a waste of paper. Why does he like triple spacing?
He says it's because he has to make a lot of corrections, because we're stupid.
We should start a petition, and get him fired!
We should, but he can find out.
I know. If he found out, he would ruin everyone's life.
He is so evil.
That's why this petition has to work!

title: A Busy Professor
content: Hey, Professor Hill.
What is it?
I've been having trouble with derivatives.
That's not good. There's a test on derivatives next week.
I know. Can I make an appointment with you for some help?
I'm a busy man.
You didn't even check your schedule yet!
I know I'm busy, because many people already made appointments.
So I'm hopeless?
Of course not! There's the tutoring center.
But the tutors are not professors. They're just students.
They might surprise you.

title: Turning Homework in Late
content: May I turn in my homework tomorrow?
It's due today.
I know, but I don't have it right now.
How come? Your dog ate it?
No! I left it at home.
I can't take your word for it.
Why not? I'm an A+ student.
How do I know if you even did the homework?
I'll ask my mom to take a picture of it and send it to me.
That's fair enough.
Thanks. Also, you should try trusting students more. We're not all that bad.
I'll try, but I can't promise anything.

title: An Honest Student
content: I have to tell you something.
What is it?
You graded my test incorrectly. I got this wrong, but you didn't mark it.
Wow! I have never met a more honest student.
I just felt wrong.
Just keep the score you have.
Really? That's awesome.
Yes. I have to ask, why did you decide to tell me?
I'm really bad at lying.
That's a good thing! Your honesty is praiseworthy.
Thanks. Want to give me extra credit?
Don't push it.

title: Borrowing Class Notes
content: Can I borrow your class notes from yesterday's lecture?
Heck no! You're so lazy.
What are you talking about? I was sick yesterday.
I don't care. Ask someone else.
You're so mean!
I can't let anyone borrow my class notes.
Why not? They're just notes.
I let a classmate borrow my notes once, and she sold copies to people.
That's crazy! For how much?
She sold each class note set for $5.
Don't worry, I promise not to sell your notes.
I can't take your word for it.

title: 90% Is a B
content: I think your grading policy is unfair.
I beg your pardon?!
Why is a 90% a B?
I'm trying to challenge you guys.
That's not a challenge, that's a punishment.
I've had this policy since I started teaching.
It's time for a change.
I'm not changing my policy because you don't like it.
Put yourself in my shoes.
I have been a student once, and I think my policy is fair.
I'm going to drop your class!
Go ahead! Less for me to grade!

title: Rounding It Up
content: I have a 89.5%.
Okay, so what?
It's really close to an A.
You know I don't round up.
But I really need a 4.0 GPA.
You get what you deserve.
I know I deserve an A. I always do great work and participate.
I can't change it.
Please? I'll wash your car.
Are you bribing me?
I just want an A.
I'll give you a C if you don't leave now.

title: Being Absent
content: Why were you absent yesterday?
Why do you care?
You should be thankful I care so much about your education.
The truth is, I didn't hear the alarm clock.
You missed out on a very important lecture.
It happens. I'll just ask my friend what was on the lecture.
Is she a good note taker?
I don't know. I guess?
If you were in class, you wouldn't have to rely on anyone's notes.
I can't change the past.
I know. Anyways, you should increase the volume on your alarm clock.
I suppose I could do that.

title: Leaving School
content: I have to leave class early tomorrow.
I don't like that. Just don't come to class.
Don't be like that, Professor! I have to attend my mom's funeral.
I'm sorry for your loss.
It's okay. I'm going to miss her.
I lost my mom when I was in college, too.
Saddest thing ever, right?
Yes. You know what? Take a week off school.
I can't do that. I have too many responsibilities.
Take my advice.
I'll think about it.
If you ever need to talk, my door is open.

title: In Need of a Counselor
content: I would like to see my counselor now.
Sorry, she doesn't have any time today.
Are you serious?
Yes, I am. Please make an appointment for next week.
I really need to see her.
I'm sorry, but you really can't.
I swear, I will bang on her door and scream.
Don't make a scene.
If you don't want me to make a scene, tell the counselor I'm here.
Fine! You can only talk to her for five minutes, though.
That's all I need.
Next time, you'd better make an appointment.

title: Talking to a Counselor
content: I'm glad you came to talk to me today.
You kind of forced me to.
That's because I'm worried.
What are you worried about?
You withdrew from 4 of your 5 classes last semester.
I was doing poorly!
And why was that exactly?
It was just too hard.
You're really behind now. You might have to spend 6 years here.
Can't I just take summer classes?
Yes, but you don't want to stress yourself out.
I don't really have a choice.

title: Adding a Class
content: I'm thinking of adding another class.
Another one? You already have 7 classes.
I know, but I really want to add Psychology 101. It seems interesting.
You're going to be so stressed out.
I think I can handle 8 classes.
Seriously? You're going to be constantly in class or studying.
I know, but it's worth it.
Tell me that when I'm partying and you're not.
How many classes are you taking? Two?
Haha! You're funny. I'm taking three.
That's so little. Don't you feel like an underachiever?
Remind me again why we're friends.

title: Writing Workshop
content: Want to go to the writing workshop with me today?
Nah man, my writing skills is tight.
You mean "are" instead of "is," right?
Yeah, of course!
You should come with me. Our college has great workshops.
I don't want to look stupid.
You won't. You look stupid using incorrect grammar.
Fine. How long is the workshop?
It's about an hour.
I don't think my attention span is more than 5 minutes.
Don't worry, I'll pinch you to wake you up.
That's a clever idea.

title: Studying Abroad
content: I'm planning to study abroad this summer.
Cool! Where are you going?
I'm going to Italy.
What are you studying there?
I'm taking a cooking class.
That sounds interesting.
I'm excited to learn in a totally new environment.
Italy seems beautiful.
It's beautiful in the pictures I've seen.
Take a lot when you're there.
I will, and I'll study hard, too.
Also, learn some Italian while you're there.

title: Job Fair
content: I hope I can find a job after graduation.
What is your major?
My major is geology.
Geology majors aren't very high in demand, but you'll do fine.
What makes you say that?
You're smart and likeable. Don't worry.
Thanks, but I'm still scared.
Oh, hey! You should go to the job fair.
We have that here?
Yes. Take advantage of it.
Have you ever been there?
Yes, and it's really helpful. Dress nicely!

title: A Restaurant by the College
content: I am so sick of dining hall food.
Me too! It's so unhealthy.
We should go to a restaurant nearby.
Want to go to Health Nut?
What a funny name!
I like it!
Do they sell nuts?
I'm not sure. Anyways, I want to try their organic tofu.
I'm allergic to tofu.
That's okay! They serve a wide variety of food.
Great! I'm just glad we're not eating dining hall food.
Me too. Let's go!

title: Vending Machine Problems
content: Why are you taking so long? Is something wrong?
Sorry, my bag of chips got stuck.
Vending machines suck, huh?
They're the worst, but the food is great.
It might come out if someone buys an item from the same column yours is on.
Can you be that "someone?"
Sure, why not? I could use some chips.
Thanks! Hey, what is your name?
My name is Charlie.
Nice to meet you, Charlie.
What is your name?
Hater of Vending Machines.

title: Forgetting Your Student ID
content: I would like to purchase the book for Sociology 130.
May I see your student ID?
I didn't know we needed it.
Please go get your ID, and get in line again.
But I waited in line for two hours!
I'm sorry, but you need a student ID to purchase textbooks here.
Are there any other options?
Show me proof that you're a student at this college, and you'll be good.
I have my report card. Here it is.
This will do. Nice grades by the way.
Thanks! I worked very hard for them.
Good luck with this semester.

title: The Overdue Hold
content: Wow! Your books are over the due date by one month.
It would have been longer if there wasn't a hold on my record.
What kind of hold is on your record?
A hold that won't let me go to the college football game.
Oh, that's tough.
Yeah. My girlfriend is actually a cheerleader, and so I have to go.
You're not going to like what I'm going to say.
What is it?
I can't remove the hold even if you pay the overdue fee.
Is it a technical error?
I don't know! I just can't remove it!
If my girlfriend breaks up with me, I'm blaming you.

title: Post-Undergraduate Plans
content: What do you plan to do after you graduate from here?
I'm planning to go to medical school. You?
I'm planning to teach English in underprivileged countries.
That's really kind of you.
Thanks. The first country I'm teaching in is Kenya.
While you're at Kenya, I'll be studying for medical school.
What kind of doctor do you want to be?
I want to be a pediatrician.
Because you like kids?
I don't really have a good reason. I just think I'll be good at it.
You should do what you love, not necessarily what you're good at.
That is very cheesy advice.

title: Purchasing a Parking Permit
content: The parking permit is $200 per semester, right?
It's actually $300.
Why?! That's ridiculous.
It's because of the budget cuts.
That's a terrible excuse.
It's the truth.
Give me something better than that.
Miss, if you don't want to pay, then don't.
This is so stressful.
I advise writing a letter to the dean.
I bet he'll just throw it away.
You would be surprised.

title: Parking Issue
content: Do you have a car on campus?
No, because it's hard to find parking here.
How do you get to places then?
I walk or take the bus.
That's crazy! I could never do that.
You should. It's great for the environment.
That's true. What do you do for fun then?
There's a lot of stuff to do around campus.
I never realized.
You should do some exploring.
You convinced me. I won't bring my car this semester.
We can walk to places together now!

title: Fighting a Parking Ticket
content: You know you can't park here, right?
Listen, I had to talk to my friend really quickly, and there was no parking spaces.
I'm going to have to give you a ticket.
I'm a broke college student.
And I'm a broke police officer. Deal with it.
Can't you just let me off with a warning?
No way. I have to be firm with you.
I'll buy you a box of donuts.
You have got to be kidding me.
I thought all cops liked donuts.
That's a stereotype. You should really learn to be quiet.
I'll stay quiet if you let me off with a warning.

title: Sports
content: I'm thinking of joining a sports club on campus.
You should! It takes away the stress of studying.
What sport do you play?
I actually play on our university's baseball team.
That's cool! You must be really good.
Yeah, I have a baseball scholarship.
No wonder you're in such great shape!
You'll be in great shape too after joining a sports club.
I'm thinking of joining the tennis club.
I wouldn't if I were you. The members don't even play tennis.
What do they do then?
They just talk about tennis. They never even touched a racket, though.

title: Clubs
content: College is so boring. All I do is go to class.
You should join some clubs.
Are you a part of any clubs?
Yes! I am currently in the Animal Lovers Club and the Knitting Club.
What do you do in the Animal Lovers Club?
We do a lot of things! Last week, we walked dogs.
That sounds fun. What's the wildest animal you ever interacted with?
I touched a dodo bird a couple weeks ago.
Dodo birds are extinct.
I'm just messing with you!
You're silly! Okay, I'll join the Animal Lovers Club.
Great! We always welcome new members.

title: Early Morning Class
content: I have to go to bed early.
Why? The night is still young!
I have a class at 7 a.m.
That's tough! My earliest class is at 9 a.m.
That sounds amazing to me.
How do you stay awake in that class?
Before I go to class, I drink four cups of coffee and take a cold shower.
Interesting routine. Does it work?
Kind of. It's better than not doing it at all.
Why are you taking that class?
It's only offered once a year, so I have to take it now.
I hope the class is interesting, at least.

title: A Bad Roommate
content: I hate my roommate.
I'm sorry to hear that. What's wrong with her?
A lot of things. First of all, she snores so loudly!
That's not really her fault. What else?
She never takes a shower.
That's disgusting! You should tell her to take a shower.
I did! She got mad at me and then proceeded to slap me.
Ouch! Did you try to get a new roommate?
I tried, but I could not. No one was willing to switch.
I guess you can get a new room by yourself.
I can't afford it. Ugh, I hate her so much.
It's okay. The year will be over before you know it.

title: Homesick
content: Are you okay? You look really sad.
I'm homesick. I feel so out of place here.
But this college is so awesome.
I know, but I really miss home.
How far do you live?
Far. Let's just say I need an airplane to get there.
It's almost winter break. Hang in there.
I don't think I can handle it anymore.
Try calling your friends and family from your hometown.
I don't want them to worry about me.
Just call them. Don't you want to stop feeling sad?
Okay, I'll call them now.

title: Changing Majors
content: I was wondering if I could change my major from biology to political science.
Those majors are very different from each other.
I know, but I hate biology. I can't see myself studying it anymore.
You can change it, but you'll have to take more classes.
I don't mind. Political science is really interesting to me.
You would be graduating a year late.
Oh, no. I have to think a little more about this then.
I think you should change it, since you hate biology.
Yeah, you're right. I'm sorry I am so indecisive.
A lot of people change majors. It's normal.
But not as late as I did. I hate that I'm graduating after all my friends.
You're making the right choice.

title: Dropping Out
content: I have decided to drop out of college.
You're making the worst decision of your life.
I just don't get the point of college. It's just memorizing.
What are you going to do then?
I'm going to get a job!
As what? A burger flipper?
Don't be mean. I'm going to be rich and successful when I'm older.
It's almost impossible to be rich and successful without a college degree.
Look at Steve Jobs! He dropped out of college.
He's a rare case.
Watch me prove you wrong.
I'd like to see you try.

title: Freshman 15
content: I gained so much weight because my college dining hall is all-you-can-eat.
It's called the "freshman 15."
What is that exactly?
It's an expression to refer to the observation that many college freshmen gain weight.
Oh, I see. I definitely got the freshman 15 then.
You should use your college's gym.
I never have time.
Oh, please! You just have to make time.
I guess I should set an hour to work out.
That's the attitude I like to hear!
Did you gain any weight?
Yeah, I just wear big clothes to hide my fat.

title: A Special Library
content: Hi, I'm here to apply for a library card.
Is this your first time applying for one?
It's my first time applying for a card here.
Do you have cards with any other libraries?
Yes, I have one with my college and one with my local library.
What college do you go to?
UCLA. They have over 10 libraries!
That's one of the great perks of higher education.
Even though I have library cards, I really like this library.
What do you like about it?
I like the foreign language books. That's rare for any library.
Yes, it is! We get people all over the world because of that section.

title: Where Is the Book
content: I really need a book, but I didn't see it on the shelf.
According to the computer, it's not checked out yet.
Then why isn't it on the proper shelf?
It means that someone in this library is holding it right now.
So someone else has the book and plans on checking it out?
Either that or someone took it out of the shelf and misplaced it.
I really need that book.
You're going to have to look everywhere for it.
Can't you just make an announcement asking whoever has the book to come forward?
You are not that special. When it comes to books, it's first come, first serve.
But I need it for school.
I'm sorry, but I can't do anything for you.

title: Tiger Books
content: Hi, can you help me find a book on tigers?
Yes, of course. Is it for a school project?
Yes, I'm doing an essay on the life of a tiger.
You're going to want one with a lot of words and less pictures.
But I want the one with pictures!
Pictures are pretty, but they won't help you with your essay that much.
Fine, I admit you're right.
You can borrow the book with pictures for your own pleasure.
Yay! I love tigers.
I have a book that isn't hard to understand, but still has great information.
Great! You're so helpful.
It's my job to be helpful.

title: Reserving a Book
content: I would like to reserve The Hunger Games.
Everyone wants to reserve that book these days.
It's really popular, because the movie just came out.
You have to pay $1 to reserve the book.
What?! That's ridiculous.
Like you said, it's popular.
I have to think about it then.
I personally think $1 is nothing. It's cheaper than buying the book.
How much is the book?
On the back, it says it's $15. It depends on the bookstore you go to though.
Fine, I'll give you a $1.
You won't regret it! The book is really good.

title: Late Fees
content: I'm sorry, but you can't borrow this book.
What do you mean?
You have not paid your late fees for your overdue books.
I never had any overdue books!
The computer doesn't lie.
What books do I have late fees for?
They're all math books, and according to the system, you still have them.
Oh yeah, I do! I totally forgot about them and left them on my bed.
Once you return them and pay the fee, you can borrow books again.
But I really need to borrow those books now.
I can put them on hold for you.
Yes! You are the best.

title: Borrowing a Book from Another Library
content: I'm so frustrated. I can't find any books on my research topic at my library.
Why don't you try a different library?
I don't want to waste gas money.
But you might find your book.
What library do you suggest?
I suggest the one near my house.
That is way too far for me.
They have a lot of books. That library has never disappointed me.
I have an idea! Why don't you borrow them for me?
I don't know about that. What if you lose the books?
I won't. I swear on my life.
Wow, you're so serious.

title: Checking Out a Book
content: This is a great book you're checking out.
You have read it?
Read it? I memorized it! It's one of my favorites.
That's good to know.
You should check out more books.
I can check out more than one?
Of course! It would be crazy if you could only get one book.
That's awesome! I'll be back.
Don't go crazy now. The limit is 15 books.
Don't worry. I'll probably come back with 5 more books.
It's great to see a kid excited about reading.
Yeah, most kids hate reading. They're more into television.

title: Checking Out a Magazine
content: Now, you can only check out this magazine for one week.
Why one week? I thought the borrowing time was two weeks.
That's for books only.
Oh, that's weird.
Well, it doesn't take that long to finish a magazine.
I know, but I like to take my time.
I don't make the rules. Would you like to check it out?
Yes, I'd like to check it out.
Interesting magazine choice. Reading about celebrities is not really smart of you.
Don't judge me. I can't read educational stuff all the time.
I do! I read Time and National Geographic.
Everyone's taste is different.

title: Checking Out a Video
content: How long do you want to check that video out for?
One week would be nice.
That will be $5.
What?! I thought I could check out videos for free.
You can check out educational videos for free.
This is bogus.
It's still not a bad price.
Okay, what if I only borrow it for a day?
It will be $2.
Okay, here's $2. So much for a library that services the public.
I hope you enjoy the movie.
For 2 bucks, I'd better love the movie.

title: Checking Books for Damage
content: There's a huge rip here.
But there's tape on it!
Did you put the tape there?
No, it was there before.
I know you're lying to me.
If you know, then why did you ask if I put the tape on?
I wanted to see if you were a liar or not.
How did you know I'm lying?
Before you check out the book, the librarian checks it for damage.
Wow, you guys think of everything.
Yes. Anyways, you owe $10.
Fine, here you go.

title: Barely Late
content: Here are the books I'm returning.
Looks like they're late. The late fee is $5.
Okay, I'm only one minute late.
One minute late, one month late, one year late, it doesn't matter.
Are you kidding me? There's a big difference between one minute and one month.
Look, the point is - they're late.
Screw you! I ain't payin $5.
I guess you'll never borrow another book, magazine, or video here ever again.
It's okay, because I don't even like this library.
This library doesn't like you either!
I am leaving! You are plain rude.
Leave! Nobody wants to see you.

title: Computer Limit
content: Miss, you have been using the computer for over an hour now.
I know, I'm sorry.
Are you looking for something?
I'm researching for my project.
Can you come back tomorrow? Your daily computer limit time is up.
I don't have a computer at home.
I'm sorry to hear that, but other people need to use the computer, too.
My project is due very soon. I need to research.
How about books? This is a library after all.
I looked for books on my project. They're not good at all.
Maybe you don't know how to look for good books. I'll help you.
Thank you. I appreciate it.

title: Using a Copier
content: How much do I need to insert here to make one copy?
It depends. Do you want your copy in color or black and white?
I want it in color.
Then it will be 20 cents per page.
That's kind of expensive.
Yeah, but most of us don't have a copy machine of our own.
I have one, but it's broken.
That sucks. Well, if money's an issue, you can copy your stuff in black and white.
No, it has to be color.
Do you really not have 20 cents?
I do, but I'm really cheap.
Well, you don't really have a choice at this point.

title: People at the Printer
content: Why is the printer line so long?
It's finals week.
Oh yeah, you're right.
This happens every year, so I got smarter.
What do you mean?
I printed my stuff for finals at home.
Oh, that is smart. I have to get in line now.
What do you have to print?
I have to print some notes.
Good luck. You'll be waiting here for a long time.
I bet the ink and paper will go out.
If that happens, you're in trouble.

title: Be Quiet
content: Can you please shut up?
Maybe if you ask nicely, I will!
This is a library, so you have to shut up.
I didn't know laughing was a crime.
It's a crime in the library.
You're just jealous, because I'm having a good time, and you're not.
No, that's not it at all.
I'll shut up if you say you're sorry.
Sorry for what? If anything, you should say sorry.
Okay, fine. I'm sorry that your parents didn't teach you how to be nice.
That does it. I'm getting a librarian.
Go get one!

title: The Library Restroom
content: Do you have a restroom?
Only for employees.
But I really need to go.
I can't let you go. There's a restroom in the market across from us though.
That restroom is really dirty. It smells like someone died in there.
Fine, I'll take you to our restroom.
Yay! Thank you so much.
We have to go secretly. If anyone sees you use the restroom, I'll be fired.
Don't worry. I will be small and quiet as a mouse.
Okay, good. The password is 595. Go quickly before anyone sees you.
Thank you for your kindness.
You owe me if we ever see each other again.

title: Volunteering at the Library
content: You should volunteer at the library with me!
What's so good about volunteering there?
It's fun, and you feel good about yourself.
What do you do there?
Everyone does different things. I organize events.
What kind of events?
Movies, art and crafts, magic shows, and more.
That does sound fun!
Do you want to sign up?
Yeah, how do I sign up?
I'll get you an application.

title: Studying at the Library
content: I can't study at home, because my family talks so loudly.
Study at the library.
Can you focus in there?
Yes, it's always really quiet.
I'll go today.
Make sure you get a good seat.
Are there not enough seats for everyone?
It depends on when you go.
I'm going at 1:00 a.m.
Dude, it's not even open that late.
But that's the best time for me.
You can always try a cafe. They tend to close late or not at all.

title: Reference Books
content: You can't check out this one. It's a reference book.
What does that mean?
It means you can only read it in the library.
But I need it for my essay.
You can take pictures of the pages you need.
I need almost all of them.
You can keep coming back here.
That's so inconvenient.
It is, but they have to be kept here.
I guess I can take pictures of the pages then.
Sorry about the inconvenience.
It is okay. It's not your fault.

title: A Gross Book
content: Ew! Look what I found in this book.
What is that?
It's a dead bug.
It's all squished and messy.
I can't read this book without being disgusted.
But don't you really want to check out this book?
I do, but I really can't.
I'll check it out then.
You can read it without being disgusted?
Yeah, I'll just skip that page.
There could be something really interesting on it.
Whatever! I'm just going to check out the book.

title: Planning to Transfer
content: I'm applying to transfer out of this college.
I'm going to miss you.
Me too. I'll text you every so often.
Why do you want to transfer?
I don't think here it is challenging enough for me.
You can join the honors program!
I did, and it wasn't challenging either.
Alright then. When are you going to start applying?
Next month. I'm already looking at the essay prompts.
Are they challenging?
Yes, but they're kind of fun!
I hope you get into wherever you want to go.

title: What College to Transfer to
content: I don't know what university to transfer to.
There's a lot, so it's all about picking what suits your needs.
For starters, I would like a university in a safe area.
Okay, what else are you thinking about?
I want to live close to home.
I think UC Irvine would be good.
I don't think that's good for my major.
What's your major?
I'm majoring in philosophy.
Yeah, you're right. UCI is not good for philosophy.
I also want to go to a college that will increase my job opportunities.
Let's go do some online research.

title: Classes Unrelated to Your Major
content: What classes should I take to transfer?
You need a little bit of everything.
What do you mean?
You need to take at least one class in every subject.
Do I need to take a math class?
Even if your major is Portuguese, you have to take a math class.
That's so stupid.
It's just to make you more knowledgeable.
But I don't even need it!
It's been like this for ages.
Well, the policy should be changed.
It won't. So in the meantime, you should register for a math class.

title: Taking Speech 101
content: Why are you taking this class?
I need it to transfer. You?
Me too! I would never take Speech 101 if I didn't need it.
Yeah, I hate public speaking.
Me too! I get so nervous.
I just want this class to be over with.
It's going to be a long semester.
Maybe after this class, we'll love public speaking.
I doubt it!
I don't even know why we have to take this class to transfer.
I guess it's to make us better speakers.
It'll all be worth it when we transfer.

title: Classes Needed for Transfer
content: You only need three more classes and you'll be ready to transfer.
Which classes do I need?
You need a history class, a physical science class, and a foreign language class.
Which history class should I take?
The one you're most interested in.
I looked at the course listing, and there's nothing I'm interested in.
In that case, go for the class you would be the least bored of.
I guess I could take European history.
There you go! How about the other classes you need?
I think I'll take physics and French.
I'm glad you know what to take!
Me too. Careful planning is part of what makes up a successful student!

title: College Application Questions
content: What are you doing?
I'm filling out my college application.
Do you need any help? I applied two years ago.
Yes, I do need help. Should I put my ethnicity?
It won't be used for or against you. It's really up to you.
Also, should I put all of my extracurriculars?
Put the ones that you were heavily involved in.
Next question, should I put anything in the "additional information" section?
If you feel like you need to say something that you didn't mention before, then yes.
Can I say I got an A when I really just got a B?
What?! Of course not! They will ask for your transcript.
Oh, I didn't know that.

title: Applying to Many Universities
content: How many universities are you applying to?
I'm applying to 12 universities.
Wow! That's a lot!
I just want a lot of options.
But it costs a lot of money and time!
I get fee waivers.
But how about the time? I mean, applying is a lot of work.
College applications ask similar questions.
Good for you. I'm only applying to three universities.
Which ones are you applying to?
CSULA, UC Irvine, and Yale.
I find it hard to believe that you can limit yourself to only three universities.

title: Lying on College Applications
content: After seeing your college application, I can tell you're really smart and talented.
Not really, I'm lying about almost everything.
Why?! They're going to find out.
No, they're not! They're not going to check.
Yes, they will. After a college admits you, they'll ask for your transcript.
I didn't know that! How about my extracurriculars?
They'll randomly audit 10% of their applicants.
What does that mean?
The UCs will randomly select 10% of their applicants to provide proof of their extracurriculars.
It's only 10%.
It's not that little! You may be chosen. Be careful.
You're right. It's too risky to lie.

title: Classes Needed for Transfer
content: I'm registering for Psych 21, because I need it to transfer.
I need that class too in order to transfer.
But there's only one space left!
That's terrible. My registration time is at 5 p.m.
Darn it! Mine is at 6 p.m.
That sucks. Maybe someone will drop out.
I doubt it. Psych 21 is needed by a lot of people.
Beg the professor?
If I have to.
You should cry! That might work.
I'm planning to. I can cry on demand.
Maybe you should take a theater class instead.

title: A Class Desperately Needed
content: I desperately need to take an English class this semester.
So does everyone else.
It's the only class I need before I transfer.
Maybe you can pay someone for their spot.
I honestly would do that if someone was willing to give up their spot.
What happens if you can't get the class?
Then I need to stay at Pasadena City College longer.
That would stink.
I know, that's why I need that class.
You can try taking it at another college.
I might do that. The closest community college is a two-hour drive.
I'm praying you get the English class.

title: Talking to a Counselor
content: I want to transfer, but I don't know where to start.
Let's start with the basics. What do you want to major in?
I want to major in biology.
Then you have to take general education requirements like everyone else.
What are those requirements exactly?
I'll give you a sheet listing all of them.
What else do I have to do?
You should fulfill some, if not all, of your major requirements.
Okay, about when will I finish?
It really depends on how many classes you take and complete per semester.
I'm planning on taking five classes per semester.
That's good! You'll be ready to transfer in about two years.

title: A Recommendation Letter (1)
content: Hey Professor Lopez, I need a favor.
What kind of favor?
Can you write a recommendation letter for me?
I'm sorry, but I can't.
Why not? I was a good student.
Yes, you were. The thing is, I don't know you that well.
I'll just give you my resume, and you can write about how great I am!
I can't. I don't think I can write you a good letter.
But I don't know who else to ask.
Ask someone who knows you as more than just a student.
I honestly never had a professor I felt close to.
Then, you can only hope a professor writes a letter for you regardless of that fact.

title: A Recommendation Letter (2)
content: My professor wrote a really bad recommendation letter for me.
You read his recommendation letter?
Yeah. I couldn't resist.
This is why you shouldn't read it. You might not like what you see.
He wrote such boring things about me.
What did he write?
Just that I'm a diligent student who does well.
At least it was nothing bad. You can always ask another professor.
I know, but I don't have time.
When do you need another recommendation letter by?
I need one by this Friday.
Oh, wow! Maybe you should just send the one you have now.

title: Personal Statement Workshop
content: I'm having trouble with my personal statement.
You should go to the personal statement workshop.
What is that?
It's where a professional will give you tips and revise your personal statement.
That sounds helpful.
It is. I went to one last week.
How was it?
The person leading the workshop was an English professor, so it was informative.
I'm kind of embarrassed to show my personal statement, though.
You shouldn't be.
I feel like I'll be laughed at.
The workshop will improve your writing. You really should go.

title: Not Accepted to a University
content: What's wrong? You look sad.
I was rejected from my dream school.
I'm sorry to hear that.
I feel so stupid. What's wrong with me?
Nothing. If your dream school doesn't want you, then that's their loss.
I don't know what to do anymore.
Look, that school didn't accept you, because you weren't the right fit.
Is that supposed to make me feel better?
I'm just saying, why would you want to go to a school that doesn't fit you?
When you say it like that, I understand you.
Yeah! Just focus on the schools that do want you.
You're right! Yale made a mistake rejecting me.

title: Deciding not to Transfer
content: I have decided not to transfer.
Why not? You kept saying you wanted to.
I know, but it's so hard getting accustomed to a new school.
That's a terrible reason not to transfer.
No, it's a good one. I feel at home here.
Sometimes, a new environment is necessary.
No, I really like it here. Also, I know what to expect.
I still think you're making the wrong choice.
Why do you want me to go?
I just think this school isn't right for you.
That's not for you to decide.
I know, but I'm just stating my opinion.

title: Accepted to a University
content: I got accepted to all of the schools I applied to.
Congrats! You totally deserve it.
How many schools did you apply to?
I applied to six.
What was your first reaction when you got into your dream school?
I was shocked. My heart stopped.
I know the feeling. It's a great one.
It is. I don't even know what school to pick now.
Same here. Who knew getting accepted would have problems?
It's a good problem!
Hey, we should visit schools together.
That would be fun!

title: First Day at a New School
content: Wow, this place is amazing.
Is this your first time here?
It's my first day at this school. I just transferred.
I see. You're going to love it here.
I think I will too.
Did you move in yet?
Yes, I have an apartment nearby.
That's good. What's your first class?
My very first class is human biology.
I hope it's educational and entertaining.
I think it will be.
I'll walk you there, since you probably don't know where anything is.

title: Where to Buy Food
content: I'm starving!
Me too. Let's get something to eat.
What would you like?
I know! Let's go down to the Farmer's Market.
What do they sell to eat there?
Only the best produce in the city!
What makes it so great?
Well it's all organically grown.
Can't we just go to the supermarket?
No way! Those vegetables don't compare at all!
I don't feel like cooking. Let's get burgers.
Fine, let's get some burgers.

title: How to Cook a Meal
content: Can you make dinner for your sister tonight?
Aw, she only eats macaroni and cheese!
What's the problem?
I don't know how to make it.
It's super easy, just follow the box instructions.
We're all out of instant macaroni and cheese.
Well, make it from scratch, then.
How do I do that?!
Just cook the pasta, and mix it in cheese, milk, and butter.
It can't be that easy.
Cooking isn't hard at all. You can do it.
If I accidentally burn the house down, it's not my fault.

title: Breakfast
content: Did you book the hotel for the trip?
Yes and it comes with something extra!
What would that be, exactly?
Continental breakfast every morning!
Wow! Do you think they serve pancakes?
Oh, with syrup and fresh fruit.
You can't forget the whipped cream!
And freshly brewed coffee!
I can't wait to see it all!
I think I'm more excited for breakfast than the trip.
Well, breakfast is the most important meal of the day.
That's very true.

title: Lunch
content: What are we having for lunch?
I'm making some sandwiches.
Can I make some lemonade to drink?
Sure! That'd be great.
We just ate breakfast, but I'm already hungry.
Me too! It's amazing how hungry I get so soon!
I'm really looking forward to those sandwiches.
I just realized we're out of bread!
I guess lunch will have to be delayed.
Can you please go to the store and buy some?
Sure! Don't drink all the lemonade!
I won't! Come back soon. I'm starving!

title: Dinner
content: Have you decided what you're going to order?
I think I want to eat a steak today.
That sounds delicious!
I've been craving one all day.
You're making me crave one now!
Well, we might as well order the steak now.
Actually, I change my mind.
What are you having?
Shrimp pasta, it looks delicious.
Do you mind if I try some of that?
Only if you give me some steak!
Alright, it's perfect, thanks!

title: Drinks
content: I'm so thirsty!
You might want to buy something refreshing.
I think I'd like a hibiscus tea.
It is kind of hot, isn't it?
Yes, it is. What'll you get?
Same as yours.
Awesome, we match!
Yeah, I guess we do!
Place the order. I'll spot you the money.
In that case, I want the biggest size.
Don't bite the hand that feeds you!
I was only kidding!

title: Fruits
content: Why are you eating another apple?
You know what they say about apples!
No, I'm afraid I don't know.
An apple a day keeps the doctor away!
Especially if you throw it at him.
You should eat fruit; it's good for you.
I do eat fruit: just not as often as you do.
Eating healthy is wonderful!
I don't doubt it, but I still want pizza for lunch.
Only if you eat an apple, too.
Alright, I'll also eat an apple.
That's the spirit! You're healthier already.

title: Salads
content: What is that you're eating?
It's a house salad.
What order are you waiting for?
Oh, I'm not waiting for an order to come.
You mean that's all the lunch you're having?
Yes, this is my lunch today.
Are you on a diet?
No, I just felt like eating a salad.
It's only got lettuce!
No. It has cucumbers and carrots, too.
What's that on the top?
Steamed chicken. It's delicious!

title: Desserts
content: What do you think I should get for dessert?
I don't know, look at the menu.
Wow! They have icecream, pies, cakes.
It looks like a great selection!
I don't know what to get!
It's kind of hot out. Maybe icecream would be good.
Icecream sounds fantastic!
How about we go to the icecream parlor down the street?
That sounds good to me! Let's go.
That pecan pie is calling my name, though.
Answer to icecream's call only!
You're right! Let's go!

title: Meat
content: What kind of meat are you buying?
I'm just buying some pork shoulders.
Why did you make them cut it in half?
It's tenderer if you do it that way.
Do you need anything else?
Yes, I need some tenderloin pieces.
You sure are buying a lot of meat.
Meat makes you strong!
And it also tastes amazing!
Would you like to come over for dinner?
Sure! I'd like to see how well you cook.
Alright! You'll find it delicious!

title: Snacks
content: Throw away those potato chips!
What's so bad about potato chips?
They'll rot your insides!
Oh, they're not so bad.
You should eat a different snack.
I think I'll have some frozen yogurt.
That is a much better snack!
I'd still like to eat potato chips though.
You had some yesterday.
I don't eat them very often.
You can have them later.
I guess that sounds pretty fair.

title: Vegetables
content: Can you cut the vegetables, please?
How do you want me to cut them?
Cut the potatoes into big chunks.
What about the carrots?
Those you can cut in rounds.
Do I do the same to the celery?
No, you can cut that into strips.
There are so many ways to cut these things!
Yes, there really are!
Can I cut the zucchini into rounds?
That's what I was going to ask you to do.
Great! I'll get started now.

title: Nutrition of Foods
content: You really need a more balanced diet!
It's fine. I eat three times a day.
All three times and all you eat is fatty foods.
I'm not always eating junk food!
Not junk food, just fatty and oily food!
Try to eat equal amounts of meat and vegetables.
Why should I measure the portions that way?
You need to eat enough protein and vitamins!
Yeah, I'll take your advice.
You'll feel much healthier.
I believe you. Thanks for the advice!

title: Ordering Fast Food (1)
content: Hi! Can I get a pizza slice, please?
Sure, is there anything else you'd like?
I'll also take that bag of chips.
What size drink would you like?
A medium soft drink, please.
Alright, you can go fill it at the fountain.
Can I also buy this banana, please?
Certainly. Will that be all?
Yes, that's all! What is my total?
Your total is $12.36.
Thank you! Have a nice day.
Thank you, you too.

title: Ordering Fast Food (2)
content: Where do I go to get my food?
Just walk around and pick what you want.
I'll take a sandwich and a pear.
I think I'll have the same.
What are you getting to drink?
I'll just have water.
Where do we pay for all of this?
Carry your tray to the cash register.
This reminds me of the school lunch line.
Well, it does work the same way.
Don't forget to grab napkins!
Thanks for reminding me!

title: Using Coupons
content: What are you carrying?
It's a newspaper with coupons.
Why do you keep looking at it?
I'm buying the fruit that is not on sale at Ralphs.
Is it on sale here?
No, but it's a bit cheaper.
Why is it cheaper?
It's a town supermarket, not a big chain.
Look! Milk prices rose.
Lucky for me. I have a coupon for Super Foods.
I have to start couponing, too.
You sure save a lot of money!

title: At the Market
content: I can't find the jasmine rice!
Isn't it in the rice section?
No, they don't have it here.
Let's check again. Is it this one?
No, that's short grain white rice.
What about this one? It's longer.
No, that's brown rice.
How are we supposed to find jasmine rice?
Oh, I see more rice in another isle.
I found it in the international section.
I find it funny that Americans think this rice is exotic!
Me, too! But Americans call everything different exotic.

title: Shopping Budget
content: Check out my birthday haul!
Wow, that's a lot of cash!
My relatives were really generous.
What are you gonna buy with it?
Well, I'm going to save half of it.
What?! You could buy so much with this!
I know, but I want to save some for later.
Well, maybe you can still afford that new video game.
No way! I'm going to stretch this money.
How are you going to do that?
I'm going to buy used games instead.
Well, I guess a used game is better than nothing.

title: Where to Buy What
content: Do you want to come with me to Walmart?
What do you need to buy?
I'm out of groceries.
Groceries are expensive at Walmart!
You really think so?
Yes! You should buy groceries at the market.
I also need some new blankets.
Well, you'd buy that at Walmart.
If Walmart sells both, why go to different stores?
You'll save money if you do.
Why will I save money by going to different stores?
Stores have different prices for different things.

title: Making a Shopping List
content: I got my roommate today!
That's great! When do you move in?
I move in next week.
Is there anything you have to take?
Yeah, there are a few things.
Write down a list so we can go shopping.
Alright. Here you go, I'm all done!
This is a pretty long list!
There's a lot of stuff I need.
I don't think you need a disco ball.
Of course I do! It goes with the strobe light.
Please write a more practical list.

title: Shopping for New Clothes
content: I need new clothes.
What kinds of new clothes?
I want something stylish.
What do you want new clothes for?
Well, school starts again in a week.
Looking good costs money, though.
I know what you mean.
The stuff you're looking for is expensive.
Yeah, I don't have much money.
Maybe you should try bargain shopping.
That sounds like something my mom would do.
Hey, moms are good at saving money.

title: Trying on a New Outfit
content: That is such a cute dress!
Thanks! I bought it yesterday.
Have you worn it yet?
No, I have to accessorize it first!
Did you buy everything you needed?
Yep! I have a matching belt, a purse, and shoes now!
Well, put it on so we can see it!
What do you think?
It looks nice on you!
Are you sure it doesn't make me look fat?
No way! It totally flatters your figure.
Thanks! I hope my boyfriend likes it, too.

title: Trying on Shoes
content: I don't know which size to get.
Why don't you check your shoes?
Sizes are different with each shoe style.
I guess you'll have to measure your foot.
how do I do that?
There's a chart by your chair you put your foot on.
Oh, I found it, thanks.
What size are you?
I'm a size eight.
You have a small shoe size for a man.
It's alright, shoe size doesn't matter.
No. Shoe size does matter.

title: Buy Furniture
content: Hey, where are you headed?
I'm going to choose some furniture at Ikea.
Are you redecorating?
Yeah. I'm tired of having mismatched furniture.
What are you planning to buy?
A couch, a coffee table, and a reading chair.
Won't that be expensive?
There's a great sale going on right now!
Oh, that's great! You'll get good prices.
I hope I find what I'm looking for.
Will you have it delivered?
No. I borrowed a pickup truck from a friend.

title: Buying an Appliance
content: I can't believe the coffee maker broke!
Well, it was a pretty old model.
I guess it did last quite a few years.
We should buy a new one.
Do you want to buy the same model?
Maybe it's time we upgrade.
What do you mean by that?
Well, now we can buy a better coffee maker.
What did you have in mind?
Maybe something with more functions!
I would really like an expresso maker.
It's settled, then! We'll buy a new coffee maker!

title: Negotiating a Price
content: Excuse me, sir. How much for this lamp?
I'll sell it to you for $50.
Oh, no! That's way too expensive.
What price did you have in mind?
Maybe something closer to one fourth that much.
I might as well give it away for that price!
What about half?
That's still not enough of a profit.
I'll give you $30 for it.
Make it $35 and you've got a deal.
Alright, that sounds good to me.
You sure drive a hard bargain!

title: Scheduling a Delivery
content: This is the perfect birthday cake for my son!
What day do you need the cake?
His party is on Saturday.
Would you like to have it delivered?
Oh yes, please. Sometime in the morning would be perfect.
I can have someone drop it off at 10:30 a.m.
That sounds perfect! It's settled.
Great! That will be $20 for the cake and $5 for delivery.
Can the delivery man enter through the back door?
Of course! Just write down your address, please.
There, all done! I also wrote my phone number.
Alright, thank you! Have a good day!

title: Not Delivered on Time
content: Hello, how can I help you?
I'm calling about your delivery service.
What seems to be the problem?
The delivery was scheduled to arrive over an hour ago.
Your cake has not arrived?
No, and I am very disappointed.
I'm sorry about that; we're a bit behind schedule.
You know I needed that cake an hour ago.
I understand. I'm sorry for the inconvenience.
Will the delivery man be here soon?
Yes, he will. And he will refund you the delivery fee.
Alright. Thank you.

title: Calling to Reschedule a Time
content: Hello, may I please talk to a store manager?
Yes. What seems to be the problem?
I scheduled some furniture to be delivered today.
Would you like to change the delivery time?
Yes. Something came up and I won't be home until 3 p.m.
That is not a problem, sir, I'll fix it.
Thank you. I was worried it had already been dispatched.
It's no problem at all.
Please tell the deliverymen to be aware of my dog.
Does he bite, sir?
No, but he may trip someone.
I'll make sure they're on high alert.

title: Getting Things Fixed
content: Thank you for coming so quickly.
What seems to be the problem?
All the channels suddenly stopped working.
Did you make sure all the cables are plugged in?
Yes, I checked and double checked them.
There may be some kind of signal interference.
Is there any way you can test that?
Of course! Give me a moment, please.
Do you know what the problem is?
Not quite yet. So you can't change the channels?
No, not at all.
Well, you'll be able to once you change the remote batteries.

title: Returning a Defective Item
content: Excuse me. I would like to return this.
What seems to be the problem?
It's not working correctly.
When did it start having problems?
As soon as I took it out of the box.
I see. Would you like to exchange it?
No, I think I'd just like my money back.
Alright. Did you pay with a credit card?
Yes, I paid with the store credit card.
I'll return the purchase price to your card.
Can I get any cash in return?
No. You now have store credit in your card.

title: Buying a Warranty
content: I would like to buy this new laptop, please.
Would you like to buy the warranty?
What is a warranty?
It's something that fixes your machine should it break.
How does it work?
If your laptop breaks, just bring it in and we'll fix it.
How much is the laptop?
It costs $550 without tax.
How much is the warranty?
The warranty is $40 for two years.
I think I'll be fine with just the laptop.
Alright, but you can always change your mind.

title: Using the Warranty
content: Hi, I need assistance, please.
How can I help you today?
My phone refuses to turn on anymore.
It looks like it short circuited.
Well, I did drop it many times.
I'm afraid I can't help you.
I guess I'll have to use the warranty.
According to your contract, you may choose a new phone.
I'll just get the same brand again.
Will you need the warranty?
No. Just have the phone.
Make sure you don't go dropping it!

title: Warranty Expired
content: Excuse me; I'd like to use the warranty on my phone.
What do you mean use the warranty?
The warranty promises a new phone if this one breaks.
Did something happen to it?
I dropped it and the screen cracked very badly.
It says here that your warranty has expired.
What! That can't be true!
I'm afraid it was only good for a year, sir.
What am I supposed to do with a busted phone?
Well, if you trade it in, you'll get a discount.
Well, I suppose it won't hurt.
I suggest you buy a longer warranty on this one, sir.

title: A News Report on Crime
content: Police are still searching for a robbery suspect in San Bernardino.
Where did you hear about this?
I saw it on the news last night.
Did he rob a store or a home?
He robbed a check cashing place.
Did he have a weapon?
He had a gun but he tricked a woman working there to let him in the back.
How did he do that?
He pretended to be blind and the woman felt bad for him.
Why would she feel bad for him?
He said he was thirsty so she opened the back to give him a glass of water.
That's why I don't use check cashing places.

title: About a Robbery
content: Did you see the police posters in the neighborhood?
I haven't seen them. What do they say?
They say not to leave anything valuable in your cars at night.
Sometimes I leave my purse in the car.
Well, the posters say that there has been an increase in car break-ins in our neighborhood.
Do they have any suspects?
The police haven't released any details yet.
I'd better be more careful about what I leave in my car overnight.
Yeah, you should be on the look out for suspicious people.
What makes a person look suspicious?
People looking into cars seems suspicious.
Maybe I'll park my car in the garage from now on.

title: Being Robbed
content: I need to report a robbery.
Who was robbed?
I was robbed.
I'm so sorry. When did this happen?
It happened 10 minutes ago.
Where were you robbed?
Right outside the bank. I had just taken money from the ATM.
Can you describe the person who robbed you?
He was wearing dark sunglasses and a Yankees baseball cap.
How much money did he take from you?
He took everything I had in my wallet.
You're going to have to fill out a police report.

title: Witnessing a Robbery
content: Can you describe the robbery you saw?
It happened right here in front of the bank.
Can you describe the suspect?
He was tall, wearing sunglasses and a Yankees baseball cap.
Did he have any weapons?
I didn't see a gun, but he had his hand in his pocket.
So he could have had a gun?
I suppose so.
Did you see which way the suspect went?
I was so scared, and was shaking, but I think he went towards the train station.
Could you pick the suspect out of a lineup?
Only if I'm sure that he can't see me.

title: Reporting a Break-in
content: Someone broke into my house.
How do you know?
The front window is broken and there is glass everywhere.
You shouldn't go in the house until we send an officer there.
I'm already in the house. The house is trashed.
Don't touch anything until the police get there.
My new flatscreen tv is gone.
Is there anything else that is obviously missing?
I can't tell unless I go further into my house.
Please wait outside in case the robber is still inside.
You think he could still be inside?
It's a possibility. A police car will be there shortly.

title: Picking a Suspect Out of a Line-up
content: Do you think you can identify the man you saw robbing the woman outside the bank?
I think I remember what he looked like.
Please take a look at the six men lined up.
Can they see me?
No, they cannot see you. This is one-way glass.
I see the man who robbed the lady outside the bank.
Can you tell us which one he is?
It's number three for sure.
Number three, please step forward.
That's him. You're sure he can't see me?
He can't see you. Thanks for your help today.
Please don't let him rob anyone else.

title: Answering Questions of the Police
content: Can you tell us what you saw?
I didn't see much. I was afraid.
Why were you afraid?
The man had his hand in his pocket like he had a gun.
Did you actually see a gun?
No, I didn't.
Did you see the man take the woman's wallet?
I did. I was inside the bank waiting on line.
Could you come to the precinct and fill out a witness statement?
Is it going to take very long?
No, it won't and an officer will drive you home.
I guess I can go to the precinct then.

title: Being Pulled Over
content: Can I have you license and registration, sir?
What seems to be the problem, officer?
You have no idea why I pulled you over?
I don't have any idea, officer.
You were going 60 miles an hour and the speed limit is only 45.
Sorry, officer. I guess I was in a rush.
Where are you rushing to?
I'm late picking up my kids from school.
I'm going to have to give you a ticket.
Can't you just let me off with a warning? I'll be more careful next time.
You could have caused an accident and never made it to get your kids.
You have a point, officer.

title: Being Arrested
content: Open the door, police.
What's going on?
We have a warrant for your arrest.
What's the charge?
You are being arrested for robbery.
I didn't rob anyone.
Tell it to the judge. Turn around, please.
I know my rights!
You have the right to remain silent.
How about my right to a lawyer?
You can call your attorney after we process you.
I'm not saying anything else until I speak to a lawyer.

title: Pleading Not Guilty in Court
content: How do you plea to the charges?
I plead not guilty.
There are several witnesses that can testify to you being the robber.
I understand that, Your Honour. But I did not do it.
There is video surveillance that shows you robbing the victim.
I would like to review that evidence, Your Honour.
Your attorney can provide you with that evidence.
I am sure I can prove my innocence once I see the footage.
Would you like to present any of that evidence now?
May I confer with my attorney?
I can call a half hour recess.
I won't need more time than that, Your Honour.

title: Being Set Free
content: Given the evidence that has just been provided, the court releases you.
I'm free to go, Your Honour?
You are free to go.
Thank you. I am happy justice has been served.
The court is pleased as well.
I don't ever plan to be back in this courtroom, Your Honour.
I sure hope not.
Your Honour, I didn't commit the crime I was accused of.
Do you know how many times I have heard that?
I'm sure many times, but I mean it.
Many people say they mean it, and I still see them before me.
I won't be one of those people.

title: Discussing a Lawsuit against the Police
content: I want to file a wrongful arrest lawsuit.
What proof do you have that you were wrongfully arrested?
Well, I didn't rob anybody.
Why were you arrested then?
I fit the description of the suspect.
Well, how was that a wrongful arrest?
They didn't investigate if I had a twin brother or not.
Do you have a twin brother?
I have an identical twin brother.
Did the police find out?
The police found out when I told them.
We may have a case then.

title: Talking to a Lawyer
content: I would like to hire you to represent me in court.
What is the court case about?
I'm being accused of robbery.
Did you commit the robbery?
No! It was my twin brother.
Do you have proof of that?
I do have proof of that. I also have an airtight alibi.
When is the next court date?
I have to appear next week.
That doesn't give me much time to prepare.
I can pay whatever you ask.
In that case, let me have my secretary draw up a contract.

title: Filing a Complaint at the Police Station
content: I'd like to file a complaint.
Of course you want to file a complaint.
Are you the on-duty supervisor?
I am the on-duty supervisor.
Than you can take my complaint.
What is the nature of your complaint?
My neighbor is illegally dumping garbage in my yard.
Would you like us to send some officers to speak to him?
They already did that and he is still throwing nasty garbage in my yard.
All right, you're going to have to see the community police officer upstairs on the third floor.
They will take my complaint?
Yes, they will take it and conduct a full investigation.

title: Dating in America
content: Dating is really complicated.
What makes you say that?
You just can't pick somebody up at a bar anymore.
So what do you do now?
There are dating websites, dating apps, even dating clubs.
My friend set me up on a blind date with my now boyfriend.
I need a friend like that.
I'll help you create an online dating profile.
I'm wary about meeting people online.
It's not that different from meeting a stranger on the street.
Dating sure isn't what it used to be.
I think there are more options now. That's a good thing.

title: Asking for a Date (1)
content: what are you doing on Friday night?
I was just going to stay in and watch a movie on Netflix.
How about you let me take you out to a movie?
That would be really nice.
We could even grab a bite to eat afterwards.
I would really like that.
Great! If I pick you up at 6 p.m., would that work?
Yeah, that gives me time to change after work.
Can I have your phone number so I can call when I'm on my way?
That's a great idea. And you should give me your number, too.
Okay, I'm really looking forward to Friday.
We're going to have a really nice time.

title: Asking for a Date (2)
content: I have an extra ticket to the Beyonce concert on Friday.
That's nice.
I was wondering if you want to come with me?
I really like Beyonce, but I'm busy on Friday.
Oh, I understand. Maybe we could go out some other time.
That's so sweet of you, but I don't think so.
Why not?
You're not really my type.
How do you know if you won't give me a chance?
Well, your insistence makes you seem a little desperate.
I'm not desperate. I've just liked you for a long time.
Again, that's sweet, but I'm not interested.

title: A Blind Date
content: Excuse me. Is your name John?
Yes, and you must be Karen.
I am. I'm sorry this is the first blind date I've been on.
Oh, me too. I'm just as nervous.
Well, that's one thing we have in common already.
You look just like the picture Jimmy showed me.
So how long have you known Jimmy?
We actually used to date.
Wow, your ex set you up on a blind date?
He knows I'm a good catch, so he let me get away.

title: Dating a long-time friend (1)
content: This is a little awkward.
I know we've been friends since high school.
I kind of always had a crush on you.
Why did you never say so?
You were dating my friend Katy.
You always gave me good advice when I was dating her.
That was so hard to do because I wanted to date you!
I'm glad we were friends first though.
Me too. I feel like we know so much about each other.
We're not starting from scratch.
No, it's a new stage in our friendship.
I think all couples should be friends first.

title: Dating a long-time friend (2)
content: Are you telling me it's not weird dating Katy after being friends with her for so long?
It's a little strange since I've known her for so long.
You also know everyone she dated.
I've given her advice on guys she's dated.
Didn't she date your best friend once?
Yeah, but he stopped being my best friend after I started dating Katy.
Why is that?
He thought I had always been after her.
Had you always been after her?
Honestly no. I really only liked her as a friend.
When did that change?
When I came back from finishing college.

title: Calling After the Date (1)
content: Hi John, this is Katy.
It's so nice to hear your voice.
I just wanted to call you and thank you for the lovely time last Friday.
I'm glad you liked the movie.
The restaurant you picked was great, too.
I wasn't sure you'd be into Greek food.
I'm hoping we can do it again soon.
I really would like that.
I have tickets to a play on Saturday.
I really like the theater.
Then you'll come with me?
It sounds like we have a second date.

title: Calling After the Date (2)
content: Hi Katy, this is John.
Oh, hey. How are you?
I'm great. I wanted to thank you for going out with me last Friday.
I'm glad you had a good time.
You didn't seem to enjoy it that much.
To be honest, I didn't like the movie you picked.
I thought a horror movie would be a great way for us to get close to each other.
You were a little too hands on.
Why don't we try again next weekend?
I really don't think so.
Are you interested in going out with me again at all?
You should probably lose my number.

title: Accepting an Invitation
content: Were you invited to Leslie's birthday party dinner?
I was. I'm really excited about it.
Would you like to go with me?
Do you mean as your date?
Yeah, why not? You and I have been out a few times together.
This will be the first time we go out in front of friends though.
Are you embarrassed to be seen with me?
Not at all. It will be really nice though.
I'll pick you up at 8:00 then?
Why not 7:30?
Why so early?
It will give us time to pick up a bottle of wine on our way.

title: Rejecting an Invitation
content: Were you invited to Barb's birthday party?
I was. It should be really fun.
Do you have a date for the party?
As a matter of fact I don't have.
Do you want to have a date for the party?
Do you know someone?
I was thinking maybe you'd want to go as my date.
Oh. I don't think that's a good idea.
Why not? You said yourself it would be fun.
The party would be fun. Going with you would not be.
Wow, that's kind of harsh.
At least I'm honest.

title: An Argument (1)
content: I thought you were going to cook dinner today.
I've been working all day.
Yeah, but you work from home. That doesn't count.
It sure seems to count when I help pay the bills.
You know I pay more bills than you do.
That's because you make more money than I do.
This is why you should make dinner.
You are so sexist.
Way to get off topic. This is about you not making dinner.
We can make dinner together or order in.
What's the point of you working from home but won't take care of the home.
You know what? I'm going out to eat by myself.

title: An Argument (2)
content: Did you water the plants?
I did this morning.
It doesn't look like you did.
Well, I did. Are you calling me a liar?
No. It's just I know sometimes you can be a little lazy.
Is this how you normally speak to people you are in a relationship with?
This is how I speak to people who are not doing what they are supposed to do.
Wow! I am really hurt by how you are talking to me.
Maybe you are feeling guilty.
No. I'm feeling like I made a mistake.
What do you mean?
I'm going to go for a walk before I say something I'm going to regret.

title: Stopping the Relationship
content: We need to talk.
Uh oh! It sounds like you are going to break up with me or are pregnant.
Funny you should mention that.
Wait! You are pregnant?
No dummy. I think we need to take a break.
A break from what?
A break from seeing each other.
So, are you breaking up with me?
Yeah, I'm sorry. This just isn't working out.
Are you going to give me the "it's not you"?
No, because it actually is you.
At least you're honest.

title: Health Insurance
content: I don't understand how health insurance works in the U.S.
Do you have health insurance through your job?
I'm a part-time employee, so that is not part of my benefits package.
You can buy health insurance based on your income.
How exactly does that work?
If you go to healthcare.gov, you can see what plans you are eligible for.
Then what happens?
You pay a fee every month and choose a primary care doctor from your plan.
What is a primary care doctor?
A primary care doctor is the doctor you visit when you have a headache or for regular check-ups.
Do I go to my primary care doctor in an emergency?
No, in an emergency, you just go to the closest emergency room.

title: A Medical Emergency
content: This is 911. What is your emergency?
I think my wife just had a stroke or a heart attack.
Can you describe her symptoms?
She is unconscious but breathing. She won't wake up.
We are sending an ambulance right now.
How do you know my address?
We can track it down through our phone system.
How long will it take for the ambulance to get here?
It should be there in less than five minutes, sir.
I think I hear the ambulance coming now.
Please let the paramedics in so they can take your wife to the nearest hospital.
Thank you. I'll open the door.

title: Going to an Emergency Room
content: I cut myself pretty badly with a knife. I think I need stitches.
Come inside so the triage nurse can stop the bleeding.
I was just preparing dinner and my hand slipped.
This cut does need stitches, but I stopped the bleeding for now.
Will you give me stitches right now?
No, since the bleeding has stopped you have to wait in the Emergency Room waiting area.
What do I do while waiting?
Fill out these registration forms.
When will I get my hand stitched up?
Here in the ER we take care of people based on how bad their injury is.
I was here before many of these other people.
Some of them are in worse shape than you.

title: A Stomachache
content: I woke up with the worse stomachache.
Did you try going to the bathroom?
I went to the bathroom, but that didn't make the pain go away.
Did you eat anything strange last night? Maybe you have food poisoning.
No. Because then I would be vomiting.
Where exactly is the pain?
It hurts here on my right side.
That's where it hurt when I had to get my appendix taken out.
It's probably just gas.
Did you take any medication?
I took an antacid an hour ago.
It should have worked by now. This could be serious.

title: A Toothache
content: Why are you holding your mouth?
I think I cracked a tooth. It hurts so much.
Did you look in the mirror?
No, but I can feel a sharp pain when my tongue touches my molars.
That sort of thing can be infected easily.
So what should I do?
You should find an emergency dentist.
That is going to cost so much money.
Yeah, but it's better than being in pain.
Do you think they'll have to pull the tooth?
Maybe they just have to seal it up.
Get me the yellow pages so I can find a nearby emergency dentist.

title: Buying Over-the-Counter Medicine
content: I have a really bad headache. What do you recommend?
You can purchase some over-the-counter pain relievers in aisle 6.
Do I need a prescription for those?
No. You just pick whichever brand your prefer and pay for it at the register.
There are so many choices.
If you read the labels, you can pick the one that is best for you.
Is there a difference between the name brand pills and the store brand pills?
Usually there isn't. Just compare the labels and look for active ingredients.
The store brand is less expensive.
Usually it is just as effective.
I sure hope so because I want to save money and not have a headache.
I think you can achieve both things.

title: Filling Prescription
content: My doctor gave me this prescription.
Can I have the paper and your insurance card?
How long will this take to be filled?
We can have this filled within an hour.
Is there any way to fill it faster? I'm in so much pain.
Unfortunately there are other prescriptions to fill.
What am I supposed to do for the hour?
We can call you when the prescription is ready.
So I can go home and take a nap.
Just leave your number here at the pharmacy and we'll call you.
Can I send someone else to pick up the prescription?
Your medication is a controlled substance so the person needs to be over 18.

title: Calling about Test Results
content: I'm calling to see if the results of some tests I took are in?
I can check for you. Can I have your name, please?
Sure, my name is Willie Foster.
Mr. Foster, your doctor is Dr. Edwards?
Yes, that's right.
Can you tell me when the tests were taken?
I was there last week.
I see your results are in, Mr. Foster.
Great! Can you read them to me?
Actually I cannot. You need to come in and see the doctor.
Are they that bad? Am I dying?
Sir, I'm just the receptionist. Why don't you come and speak to Dr. Edwards?

title: Calling in Sick
content: Hello, this is Isabel Foster.
Hi, Isabel. Why are you calling? You can just come to my office.
I'm actually not in the office right now.
You aren't? Well, why not? Is everything okay?
Actually everything is not okay. I'm pretty sick.
I'm sorry to hear that.
I'm not going to make it into the office today.
There's no way you can come in, just finish that report?
If I come in, I may give everyone what I have.
Well, what do you have?
I have a really bad stomach flu.
Eww yeah, in that case, stay home.

title: Discussing Test Results
content: What brings you into my examination room today?
I'm here because your receptionist told me I needed to come in to discuss my test results.
Well, let me take a look at your file.
The receptionist made me nervous when she wouldn't tell me the results over the phone.
Legally she can't tell you the results.
So is it bad, doctor?
Your cholesterol is a little high.
Does that mean I'm going to die.
Let's not exaggerate.
I'm going to be okay?
If you change your diet and exercise more, you will be fine.
I will do whatever it takes to be healthy.

title: Changing an Appointment Time
content: I'm calling because I need to reschedule my appointment.
What was the original appointment date and time?
I am supposed to come in on Thursday at 10 in the morning.
Are you Tina Williams?
That's me.
When would you like to reschedule the appointment for?
Can Dr. Harris see me next Tuesday at 10?
He doesn't have an opening that day until noon.
I'll have to come on my lunch break then.
So shall I give you that appointment time?
Yeah, put me down for that time.
Just let us know 24 hours in advance if you need to cancel or reschedule.

title: Going Home Early Because Of Being Ill
content: Can I have a minute?
What is going on?
I'm really not feeling very well this afternoon.
Oh, I'm so sorry to hear that.
Do you think I can leave the office early?
Well, I have some medication here on my desk.
I already took some pills and they really aren't helping.
It's just that we have the report due today.
I already gave Dennis what I have so far.
He knows how to finish it?
I emailed him detailed instructions.
All right, go home then, but leave your phone on so we can call you if we have questions.

title: Having a Blood Test in the Lab
content: I'm here to have some blood tests done.
We take all the samples in the back room, so please follow me.
I usually have blood taken at the doctor's office.
More and more doctors are outsourcing that to private labs now.
It's kind of pain because I have to make another appointment to go somewhere else.
I understand, but we are professionals.
So you won't mind if I scream when you take blood?
Are you a screamer?
Sometimes I even faint.
I have a very gentle touch.
I'm going to close my eyes.
Well, first you need to fill out these forms.

title: Having a Cold
content: I'm so sick of being sick.
Have you been taking any medicine?
I have taken every over-the-counter medicine in the pharmacy.
Maybe you need a prescription for an antibiotic.
I went to the doctor, and he says it's viral so no antibiotic will help.
Have you tried any home remedies?
What do you suggest?
You can try sitting in the bathroom with the shower running so it's all steamy.
What will that do?
It will help with the congestion.
Yeah, but I can't sit in the bathroom all day.
Do it in the morning and before you go to bed.

title: Making a Doctor's Appointment
content: I need to make an appointment to see Dr. Taylor.
Are you already a patient of Dr. Taylor?
No, this is the first time I've been seeing him.
What kind of appointment is this?
It's for my annual physical.
Can you tell me what insurance you have?
I have Blue Cross.
The earliest appointment I can give you is Wednesday, September 3 at 10 in the morning.
That works for me.
Please bring in your health insurance cards when you come in on that day.
Will you send me a reminder in the mail?
If you give us your phone number, we will remind you the day before.

title: Blood Pressure
content: Your blood pressure is very high.
What does high blood pressure mean?
High blood pressure or hypertension means that there is a lot of pressure on your arteries.
That doesn't sound very good.
It isn't very good because it means you are at higher risk to develop heart disease.
I feel fine, though.
High blood pressure is called a silent killer.
What causes high blood pressure?
It could be the sign of some other diseases.
I am already taking medication.
You should tell me the medications you are taking because some meds cause high blood pressure.
I'd better change my lifestyle.

title: Not Feeling Well
content: Wow, you really look terrible.
Thanks a lot. I really feel awful.
