You're right about that. So can I count on you to help me?
You bet. I would be happy to help you move.

title: Calling a Moving Company (1)
content: Hey, were you able to find a new home to move into?
Yes, I did. Now I just have to move my things over to the new place.
That's great! I'm glad you found a new place.
Me too. Have you ever used a moving company before?
Yes, I have. And the company is not bad.
I'm planning on moving soon. I have never called a moving company before.
Oh, I see. You have to call them as soon as possible.
Really? Why is that?
Moving companies tend to get booked really fast, especially during the summer.
That makes sense. I guess I should call a moving company right now.
Good luck. I hope the move transitions smoothly.
Thanks you for your advice. See you later!

title: Calling a Moving Company (2)
content: Hello, am I calling a moving company? My friend gave me you guys' number.
Yes, this is indeed a moving company.
That's a relief. I thought I was dialing the wrong number.
No, you called the right place. Are you in need of any moving assistance?
Yes, very much so. I'm moving in one week, and I need a pair of strong and able movers.
We can provide you with that kind of help.
That would be fantastic.
Just give me your information and we'll have you set up in no time.
Thank you very much.
You're welcome. The movers we provide will help with all your belongings.
That's good. I have a lot of stuff.
Rest assure, that won't be a problem.

title: Where to Put the Furniture (1)
content: Please be carful with that.
Don't worry, we are professionals. Your furniture is safe in our hands.
Thank you. That's reassuring to hear.
Now, where do you want this couch?
Let me think. Right here is a good spot.
Next to the window over there?
Yes, that's the spot. You could put it down there.
Alright, next we have these end tables. Where do you want them?
I want them against this wall please.
There you are. Nice and gentle. See, I told you we were professionals.
Thank you. I feel more secure now seeing you work.
Well, that's good. Let's go get the rest of your furniture.

title: Where to Put the Furniture (2)
content: Thanks for helping me move in all my furniture.
No problem at all. It's a pleasure.
Can you help me decide where to place them?
Sure. Where should we start?
Let's start with the living room. Where do you suggest we place the couch?
Maybe against that wall. Then the television can be placed at the opposite end.
Good idea. Let's do that. Thank you for helping.
You're welcome. Where would you like to place these bookshelves?
I would like it against the wall with the window.
Would you like it placed to the right or left side of the window?
I would like it placed on the right side.
Good choice. Let's move the bookshelf together.

title: Calling the Water Company (1)
content: Hello, is this the water company?
Yes it is. How can I help you?
I just moved into my first home. I have a few questions.
Alright. What questions do you have?
What are my payment options?
You can pay online, by mail, or in person at designated areas.
Are you guys responsible for any plumbing problems?
The costumer is responsible for their home plumbing problems.
What information do you need in order to begin my water service?
We will need your full name, social security number, and the address to your home.
Thank you. That is all I need to know.
You're welcome. Thank you for calling. Have a nice day.

title: Calling the Water Company (2)
content: You have called the Water Company. How may I assist you?
Hello, I recently moved into my apartment.
Are you calling to activate your billing?
Yes, that's one of the things I'm calling about.
What was the other reason for your calling today?
There is leakage in one of the pipelines. Is there anything you can do about that?
No, I'm sorry. But I could provide you contact with one of our plumbers.
No, that's not necessary, but thank you.
As for your billing, what form of payment would you like to have?
Can I pay online?
Yes, that is a service we do provide for our customers.
Alright, I think I'll go with that form of payment.

title: Greeting the Neighbor (1)
content: Hello, neighbor. I would like to personally welcome you to the neighborhood.
Thank you. It is a pleasure to meet you.
Same here. It's been a few days. How do you like it so far?
I like it. It's convenient for both my job and my family.
That's good to hear. You'll find this neighborhood to be very peaceful.
That's another thing I like about it. My wife thinks the area looks lovely.
Are you doing anything tomorrow afternoon?
No, why do you ask?
I'm having a barbecue in my backyard. I want to invite you and your family.
Sure, I'd be happy to join!
Alright. Here's my number. I'll see you tomorrow!
Thank you. I'll see you then.

title: Greeting the Neighbor (2)
content: Greetings, neighbor. How's it going?
Hello to you! It's going just fine. Welcome to the neighborhood.
Thank you. How long have you been living here?
It's going to be my tenth year next month.
That's quite some time. Where did you move in from?
I was living in San Diego before I moved here.
That's interesting. Why did you decide to leave San Diego?
I simply felt that it was time for a change.
I see. I've had that feeling before.
why are you moving here.?
Because my new job is in the area.
Well, I'll be seeing you around, my new neighbor.

title: Questions about Parking
content: Hello. I'm new to the apartments. I have a question.
Hello, and welcome. What do you need to know?
Is there anything about parking my car that I need to know?
You have an assigned parking spot behind the building.
Are there other parking spots available?
Yes. We have several unassigned spots for visitors.
Where are those visitor parking spots located?
Behind the building as well.
What if all parking spots are filled up?
You could park in the streets, but you might be ticketed if you fail to follow rules.
Could you show me how to enter the parking area?
Yeah, I'll show you. Follow me.

title: Prohibited Parking
content: Excuse me, sir?
Yes, is there a problem?
I'm sorry to be the one to tell you, but you can't park here.
You mean right here, where I just parked?
Yes, unfortunately you cannot.
Oh, I was not aware that you couldn't park here.
That's alright. It's a common mistake new residents often make.
Thank you for informing me.
Not a problem. I wouldn't want you to get a parking ticket.
That's so considerate of you. Thank you.
You're welcome. Just keep it in mind for the next time.
Don't worry. I won't forget.

title: Meeting the Mailman
content: Good morning. Are you the mailman?
Good morning to you, and yes, I am. What gave it away?
Your uniform was a clear indicator.
That's a good answer. So you're the new tenant?
Yes, I am. I just moved in last week.
I extend to you my welcome. How do you like the neighborhood?
It's absolutely wonderful. Everybody here is so friendly.
You're not wrong. I haven't come across anybody who wasn't nice.
Wow, it sounds like I picked the perfect neighborhood to move in to.
Yup, there's no doubt about that.
I hope I never move again.
I have more deliveries to make, so I'll talk to you later.

title: Asking about Local Restaurants
content: I sure am hungry.
You should go out and eat.
Do you know of any good places to eat that are around the local area?
I know of a good couple.
Alright, let's hear them. I'm starving.
Let me ask you first, what are you in the mood for?
Well, now that I think about it, I'm not really sure.
Do you like Indian food?
I have never tried it. It sounds interesting.
It's delicious. I would recommend giving it a try.
Indian food it is!

title: Trash and Recycling (1)
content: Why do you have so many full trash bags?
I had a party last night. I'm cleaning up now and tossing them away.
Wait! What are you doing?
Throwing these bags into the trash can. Why do you seem concerned?
Did you divide the recyclables from the trash?
No, I didn't. I was a bit lazy to do so.
Don't be lazy. You should do your part in helping the environment.
You're right. It's going to be messy though. Mind giving me a hand?
Sure. I'd be glad to.
Thank you. This is a lot to handle alone.
Don't mention it. After all, one person can make a big difference to the environment.
I'll be sure to be more considerate next time.

title: Trash and Recycling (2)
content: Do you know where I could dispose of my trash?
Yeah, there are two different colored trash cans in the back.
Is there a difference between the two?
Well, one is for recycling and the other is for trash.
Can you tell me which color is the one for recycling?
That would be the blue trash can.
And the black trash can is for regular trash?
That is correct.
On what day does the garbage truck come by to pick up the trash?
It comes every Thursday.
Thank you for your help. Take care.
Sure. Don't mention it.

title: Where Is the Laundry Room
content: Hello, neighbor. I just moved into the apartments last week. I have a question.
Sure. What do you need to know?
I need to locate the laundry room. I have a load of clothes to wash.
There is one downstairs.
Thank you very much.
There is also another located in the basement of the neighboring building.
Do I have to pay at a front desk?
No, the machines require exact change. I suggest you take quarters.
Does the laundry room carry detergent?
Yes, but I recommend you take your own. They're expensive.
That's good to know. Thanks again and have a nice day.
No problem. See you around.

title: Laundry Room Rules
content: I need to wash my clothes.
As a tenant of this apartment, you have access to the washer and dryer.
Is that so? I didn't know that.
It's good that you know now.
Are there any laundry rules I should know about?
Yes. There are certain hours you are allowed to use the laundry room.
What are the hours?
You are only allowed to wash clothes from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.
That's good to know. Is there anything else I should know?
You're responsible for your belongings.
Well, that's common knowledge.
Also, there is no food or drink allowed in the laundry room.
Thanks for going over the rules and hours with me.
It was my pleasure to help a fellow neighbor.

title: Asking for Directions (1)
content: Excuse me. Can you give me a minute of your time?
Sure, I don't see why not.
Thank you kindly. I'm pretty new in town, and I think I might be lost.
Do you need to make a phone call?
No, thank you. I just need some directions.
Where are you trying to get to?
I need to find my way back to Colorado Boulevard.
Colorado Boulevard? Why, you're not far off from there.
Can you point me towards the direction of that street?
Gladly! You're going to walk straight down this street.
Alright, straight down.
Then you make a right after two blocks.
Alright, I got that.
Then a left at the next street, and you should be there.
Thank you so much.
You're welcome. Have a safe trip.

title: Asking for Directions (2)
content: You look lost. Are you in need of any directions?
I was just about to ask someone for directions. Thank you for noticing.
Where are you from?
I'm from the inner city.
You're a long way from home then. Are you looking for a certain street?
Actually, I need directions to the nearest public bus.
Which bus number are you looking for?
I'm looking for Line 267.
I know that bus. The stop is just around that corner.
Where? Over there?
In that direction.
Thank you so much. I appreciate the help.
You're welcome. Safe travels, my friend.

title: Neighbors and Help (1)
content: Hello, neighbor. How are you today?
I'm fine. How are you?
I'm doing alright. I was wondering if I could ask you for a favor.
Sure. What is it?
I'll be away for the weekend. Could you take care of my dog?
Yeah, I'd love to. I'm great with dogs.
Oh, that's fantastic! Thank you very much!
Is there anything I need to know about your dog?
Not really. She's an old, calm, and friendly dog. You'll have no trouble.
Alright. I'll give you a call if I have any questions or concerns.
I'll bring her over in a few minutes along with her food. Thanks again!
No problem. Have a safe trip.

title: Neighbors and Help (2)
content: Are you my new neighbor?
Yes, I am. It's nice to meet you.
Nice to meet you, too.
How is your day going so far?
It's going just fine. Thank you for asking.
Do you think you can help me with something?
Sure, I would be glad to help, whatever I can.
It's nothing big. I just need help carrying my old couch to the curb.
Alright, do you want me to help you right now?
If it's not a problem.
No. I'll come over right now.
Thank you for the assistance.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (1)
content: I have a question about my one-room apartment.
What do you need to know?
Am I allowed to have extra people living with me?
You are only allowed one roommate, but they'll need to have an application on file.
Will I be charged extra for any additional people?
Yes. And you'll also need special permission for that.
Are my visitors allowed to use any of the facilities?
Yes, but you have to be present with them.
Are occasional guest sleepovers fine?
As long as it is occasional, it should be no problem.
Thank you. That is all I needed to know.
Alright. If you have any more questions, don't hesitate to ask.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (2)
content: Come inside my apartment! Make yourself feel at home.
Thank you for letting me visit you today.
It's always nice to meet extra tenants of the apartment.
How do you like the apartment so far?
I don't like it, I love it!
I'm glad to hear that.
Everybody I've met is super friendly, and the apartment is beautiful.
I share the exact same thoughts.
How long have you been a tenant here?
Not long. I moved in a few months ago.
Would you like a drink?
Sure, I'm kind of thirsty.

title: Key and Lock Problems (1)
content: Are you locked out of your apartment?
It appears that I am.
Did you forget your key inside your apartment?
No. I think I lost it somewhere in the city.
That's unfortunate. I think I could help you.
Really? Do you have another key?
No, but the landlord does.
He doesn't live here though.
I have his phone number. I'll just give him a call.
Thank you. If you want, I'll talk to him myself.
No, don't worry. I talk to him for you.
Please I insist. I should be the one to ask for help since I'm the one who's in need of it.
Alright, suit yourself.

title: Key and Lock Problems (2)
content: Help, please. My key won't open the front door to my apartment.
Oh, no. Let me try to help you.
Thank you, but I don't think there's much you can do.
Don't be so pessimistic. I'll help you unlock that door.
I already tried using the key. There's no use in trying anymore.
I have another idea. Care to hear it?
Alright, I don't have any other options.
Let me drive you to a locksmith.
What good will that do?
A locksmith can replace your key. The one you have now is probably broken.
It's worth a try, I guess.
There's the spirit! Come on, let's go.

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
content: Have you checked your smoke detectors recently?
No, I wasn't even aware we had smoke detectors.
All the apartments are equipped with them. It's an essential safety feature.
How do you check if they're working?
It's real easy. If you like, I could show you.
That would be nice of you.
Are you doing anything right now?
No. It's my day off work.
How about I come over and show you how to check them?
Sounds good. Come inside.
It's really easy to check them. Just grab one from the wall, and check the battery in the back.
What does this light mean?
If you see the light, that means it's functioning.
So I don't need to replace the battery. Thank you so much.

title: Mailbox Key Missing
content: Have you seen my mailbox key lying around somewhere?
No, I'm sorry. Where did you last leave it?
I thought it was in my pocket.
Is that where you last put it?
Yeah, I'm pretty sure.
Think hard. Where was it before you supposedly put in your pocket?
I was in my apartment cleaning out the kitchen.
Maybe you emptied your pockets while you were cleaning.
Wait! I think I did empty my pockets!
There you go. I knew it.
I remember now. My keys are on the kitchen counter.
That's a relief.

title: Locked Out
content: Oh, no! I'm locked out again.
Did I overhear you say what I think you just said?
That I'm locked out? Yes, that's what I said.
I'm sorry to hear that. How did you lock yourself out?
I'm pretty sure I left my key inside the apartment.
That happened to me before.
What did you do when it happened?
I climbed into the window to unlock the door.
That doesn't sound like such a bad idea.
Unless you have a spare key.
It seems I'm going to have to break into my own apartment.
Be careful not to break anything.
Is that what you did when you did the same?
Accidentally, yes, I did.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (1)
content: I'm sorry to knock on your door at this late hour.
Is there something wrong?
It's just one minor issue I have to bring up with you.
Don't tell me. I think I know what it is.
I hope you can understand.
I completely do. I'm so sorry. I didn't realize how loud my television was.
It's just a little too loud. If you could just lower it a tad bit.
This is so embarrassing for me. You have my sincerest apology.
No, that's alright. It happens to all of us at one point.
It's these new speakers that I bought. I'm just learning how to use them.
Please, say no more. Let's just put the matter to rest.
This won't happen again.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
content: Can I help you with something?
Yes, I hope that you can.
What seems to be the problem?
Do you know what time it is?
It's eleven o'clock at night.
Actually, it was eleven an hour ago.
Oh, you're right about that.
I live right next door to you, and your loud music is keeping me awake.
Is that so? It's really that loud?
Yes, it is. I'm going to have to ask you to lower down the noise.
Sorry about that. I'll lower down the music.
Thank you. Please be a little more considerate next time.
I will. Again, I apologize for the noise. It won't happen again.
I sure hope it won't.

title: Plumbing Problems
content: Who do I have the pleasure to speak to this afternoon?
Hello, my name is James.
You've called your city's local plumber. What can I do for you?
Thank you. I have a problem with my gas line.
I specialize in gas line problems. You're in luck.
I'm glad to hear that. Can you come to my home today?
I'm booked today, sorry. Can I come tomorrow instead?
Tomorrow works for me too. Is three o'clock fine?
Yes, that hour is fine.
What are your rates?
I will provide you with an estimate free of charge when I see the problem.
Alright, that sounds good. Thank you.

title: Poor Upkeep
content: This floor is falling apart.
How can you tell?
Are you kidding me? Step over here.
You're right. The floor to this apartment is badly damaged.
See, I told you so.
What did you do that made the floor like this?
It wasn't me. It was like this when I moved in here.
You should report this poor upkeep to the landlord.
You're right. I'll call him the first thing in the morning.
Be carful not to damage the floor any further.
I won't. I hope the landlord replaces the floor soon.
He probably will.

title: Reporting a Problem to the Landlord
content: The floor to my apartment is badly damaged.
I'm sorry to hear that. How bad is it?
It's practically falling apart.
Did some kind of accident cause this?
None that I could've made. I think your previous tenant might have caused this.
That makes sense. He took poor care of the apartment.
I could see that myself.
I'll have that fixed as soon as possible.
If it's not too much trouble, may I request one more thing?
Is there anything else wrong in the apartment?
It's just my bedroom window. I can't seem to get it open.
I'll have that window taken care of as well.

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
content: You seem a little lost.
I actually am lost. How could you tell?
The look on your face said it all.
Maybe you could help me.
I'd be happy to help.
I'm not sure what bus I'm supposed to take.
What's your destination?
I'm heading to Westwood.
I've been there several times by bus.
You have? What bus did you take?
The Line 720 takes you directly there.
Where is the stop for that bus?
Right at the corner over there.
Thank you very much.

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
content: Excuse me, sir. Care to help me?
What can I do for you?
I'm trying to make way back home, and I'm not sure what bus to take.
Where do you live?
I live in the city of Bell.
I've never heard of that city.
I'm not surprised you haven't. It's not a big city.
What are the surrounding cities?
They're Maywood, Huntington Park, and Downey.
I'm familiar with the city of Downey.
Would you know how to get there by bus?
Yes. Take 764 bus northbound.
Thank you. I'll find my home from there.
You're welcome. Good luck, and take care.

title: Taking the Bus for the First Time
content: I've never taken the bus before.
This is your first time? Wow, that's surprising.
How is it surprising?
I've just never met anyone who hasn't taken the bus before.
Well, now you could say you have.
Why are you finally taking the bus for the first time?
I figured it would be a good way to save money.
That's for sure considering the price of gas nowadays.
No kidding. Listen, I have a few questions about taking the bus.
What are they? I'm sure I could answer them for you.
I was wondering how often the buses pass by.
They usually pass by every thirty minutes, but it could vary.

title: Paying the Bus Fare
content: Hello, bus driver. How are you doing today?
Good afternoon. I'm doing just fine.
This is my first time taking the bus.
Is that so? I hope you have enough change for the bus fare.
Yes, I do. Don't you worry about a thing.
That's good. Just put your money into the machine and take a seat.
It's one dollar and fifty cents for the fare, correct?
Yes, that's correct.
Thank you. There you are. I told you I had enough.
Thank you, you're fine to sit down now.
Is there anywhere I can't sit?
The front seats hold priority for the elderly and disabled.

title: Asking for a Transfer (1)
content: I'm trying to get to the city of Lakewood. Does this bus take me there?
No, I'm sorry. You're going to have to make a transfer.
Can't I simply get on another bus?
You could, but you would have to pay again.
I don't think I want to pay again.
Especially when a transfer is free.
How do I get a transfer?
All you have to do is approach the bus driver and ask for one.
Alright, I will do that right now. Thanks for the help.
Have a safe bus ride.

title: Asking for a Transfer (2)
content: Excuse me. I would like to get a transfer.
Do you have your day pass with you?
It's a month pass. Is that okay?
Yes, that's fine. Please scan your pass on the machine.
Did it scan?
Yes it did. Alright, it's going to cost one dollar for the transfer.
I'm sorry. I don't think I have enough for the transfer.
Is this your first time getting a transfer?
Yes, it is. I thought transfers were free.
I'll let it pass since it's your first time.
Thank you so much. It won't happen again.
Don't mention it. Just be prepared the next time.

title: Where to Get Off (1)
content: What's wrong? You seem unsure about something.
I'm unsure of where to get off the bus.
Where are you coming from?
I got on the bus in Pasadena.
Where are you heading to?
I'm trying to go downtown.
I could tell you where to get off.
You can? That would be very nice of you. Thank you.
I'm happy to help a stranger anytime.
What's the street that I should get off on?
You're going to get off on Wilshire.
How much further is that stop?
The bus is fifteen minutes away from there.
We're pretty close then.

title: Where to Get Off (2)
content: Is this your first time riding the bus?
Yes, it is. How did you tell?
The look on your face gave it away.
I really do look that confused?
I'm sorry to say so, but don't be embarrassed.
You seem friendly. Would you mind answering a question?
No, not at all. What's your question?
I'm trying to get to the airport. Do you know where I should get off?
This bus actually drops you off right in front of the airport.
I know that it does. I've just forgotten on what street.
The stop will say LAX Airport.
Oh, really. That's pretty obvious.

title: Complaining about a Late Bus (1)
content: This bus is taking so long!
You're right. It's running late.
It was supposed to be here thirty minutes ago.
Just be a little more patient. I'm sure it'll arrive any minute now.
We're going to be so late, all because of this late bus.
The buses usually come on time.
They should always be on time. Don't they know people depend on their swiftness?
Just wait a little longer.
I'm tired of waiting. This bus is never going to come.
Complaining is not helping the situation.
I have every right to be complaining!
Suit yourself then.

title: Complaining about a Late bus (2)
content: How long have we've been waiting for this bus?
Almost one hour. I think it's late.
It is late! What is taking this bus driver so long to get here?
Probably traffic. You know how traffic could be on the weekends.
That is not a good excuse. Bus drivers should know how to maneuver past traffic.
That's easy for you to say.
I just want the bus to arrive already. I want to go home.
It's bound to arrive any minute now.
I hope you're right. My patience has all extinguished.
Wait. I think I see it coming in the distance!
Thank goodness! I couldn't possibly wait another minute.
False alarm. It was just a truck. Sorry about that.

title: Getting Off Too Early (1)
content: Wait a second. Where am I?
You're in Los Angeles.
Los Angeles? Oh, no. I got off the bus too early.
Where were you going to?
I need to get to Westwood.
Just hop on the next bus.
And wait exactly how long for it?
Not long. I can tell you that.
Maybe I should just take a taxi.
Take my word, young man, the next bus won't take long.
When will the next one arrive?
I'd say in less than ten minutes.

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
content: Is this Gage Avenue?
No, this is Florence Avenue.
Oh, no. I must've gotten off the bus too early.
Don't worry. We all make mistakes.
Thank you for that.
Maybe I can help you get to where you're going.
Are you sure it wouldn't be any trouble?
No trouble at all.
How much further is Gage Avenue?
Not too far. It's a fifteen-minute walk from here.
Can you please point me towards the right direction?
Sure. You're going to head south from here.
South is that way?
No that's north. South is the opposite way.

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
content: I have so many places to go today.
Are you planning on taking the bus?
Yes. I'm going to have to bring so much bus fare with me.
You don't have to. Just buy a pass for the day.
A pass? What's that?
It comes in the form of a card that allows you to pass on any bus.
And is it just for one day?
You can buy a bus pass for the day, week, month, and even a year.
I didn't know that. How do I buy one?
You can ask for one on the bus.
How much does the card cost?
The card itself is one dollar, but a pass for the day is five.
I only need to bring six dollars with me today?
Yes. Unless you want to buy a pass for a week or longer.

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
content: Hello, I would like to buy a bus pass.
Do you have a card to use for your pass?
What kind of card do I need?
It's a card I can provide you with.
Is it free to get?
No, but it's only one dollar.
It's nearly free. Here's the dollar.
Do you also have money for the day pass?
Yes, I do. How much is it for a day pass again?
Exactly five dollars.
I do have enough. Do I give you the money?
No, please deposit it into the machine.
Alright then. There you go.
Here's your pass for the day. Do take care of that.
Thank you very much. I'll hold on to it.
You're welcome. Have a nice day.

title: How to Buy a Pass (3)
content: I have never bought a bus pass before. Do you know how?
Yes I do. You can buy it from the bus driver.
What kinds of bus passes do they have?
They have day passes, week passes, and month passes.
How much is the monthly pass?
It's 64 dollars, but if you're a student, you can get it for 35 dollars.
Yes. I'm a student. I think I'll get the monthly pass.
Since you'll be getting the student discount, you need to show your student I.D.
Alright. Thank you for your help.
No problem. Anytime!

title: Missing the Bus Stop (1)
content: Does this bus stop at Normandy Street?
Yes, it does. Is that your stop?
Yes, it is. How much further until the bus gets there?
Actually, the bus passed by Normandy Street ten minutes ago.
I missed my bus stop? Darn it, I knew this would happen to me.
Are you on your way to work?
Fortunately I'm not, or else I would've been running late.
Are you meeting a friend?
Yes, I am actually. I'm going to have to call him, and tell him I missed my stop.
You should get off on the upcoming stop.
Good idea. I'll just walk back to Normandy.
It might be a long walk.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (2)
content: Look! The bus is coming!
Let's see if we can cross the street in time to catch it.
I don't think we are going to make it.
You are right. There it goes.
When will the next bus arrive?
According to the bus stop pamphlet, it should arrive in about fifteen minutes.
We are going to be a bit late.
I hope our friends don't get impatient.
Hopefully they'll understand.
It should be here any moment now.
Look! Here it comes!
Get your bus pass ready to hop on board!

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)
content: I don't recognize any of these streets.
Is this your first time riding this bus?
No, I take this bus to school every day.
This bus always drives by these streets.
Are you sure this is not just a new route.
I'm pretty sure it's not.
Perhaps it could be a detour.
Perhaps you might be on the wrong bus.
There's no way this is the wrong bus.
If you don't believe me, maybe you should go ask the bus driver.
Wait, I don't think I have to. You're right, this is the wrong bus.
I hate to say I told you so, but I told you so.
How could I make such a dumb mistake?
You should get off on the next stop.

title: On the Wrong Bus (2)
content: Excuse me, bus driver. I have a question.
What do you need to know?
I don't recognize where I'm going. Where are we?
You are on the bus headed to East Los Angeles.
Oh, I see. I believe I have gotten on the wrong bus.
Well, I'm sorry, but I can't give you a refund.
That's fine. I need to go to Pasadena. Can you give me directions?
Sure. I have a bus pamphlet for you, too. Here you go.
Thank you. I'm new to the area.
Don't worry. It happens. I'll let you off down here.
Alright. Thank you very much. Have a nice day.
You too, and good luck getting to Pasadena.

title: Student Discount (1)
content: Top of the morning to you, Mr. Bus Driver.
Hi, good morning. Where are you off to today?
It's my first day of college.
Wow, you must be very excited.
You have no idea how much I am.
Do you know how to get there?
It's actually just a bus ride away.
Are you planning on taking the bus routinely?
Yes, I am. Why to spend money on gas when I could take the bus for less?
You know, as a student you're eligible to receive a discount.
No kidding. How much is the discount?
Are you paying for a month pass?
Yes, it cost fifty dollars.
Well, with a student discount it would cost twenty dollars less.
Thirty dollars for a month pass? That's quite a discount!
You should take advantage of it.

title: Student Discount (2)
content: Hi, I am here to buy a bus pass.
Alright. What kind are you interested in getting?
I'm not sure. This is my first time.
If you need a monthly pass, it will be sixty-four dollars.
Is there anything cheaper than that?
If you're a student, you get a discount.
Yes. I am a student. How much will it be for a student discount?
The student discount for a monthly pass is thirty-five dollars.
Alright. I think I'll take that.
First I'll need to see your student ID. Then you're all set.
Here is my student ID. Thank you very much.
Here you go. Have a nice day!

title: Talking on the Bus (1)
content: I'm going to be so late. This bus driver is driving so slowly.
Where are you in a hurry to?
I have doctor's appointment. I hope I make it on time.
I'm sure you will. Where's your clinic?
It's in Long Beach.
I'd say we're about twenty minutes away from there.
I sure hope you're right about that. Where are you heading to?
I'm going to visit my grandma.
Where does she live?
She's also in Long Beach.
What a coincidence! Do you often ride this bus to visit her?
I have for the past two years. I visit her every Sunday.
That's so sweet of you. You must love her very much.
I do. Why are you going to the doctor's?
To get my routine check-up. Nothing serious.
It's so nice to meet friendly people on the bus.

title: Talking on the Bus (2)
content: Hi! Can I ask you a question?
Sure. What do you need to know?
Is this bus headed toward Monterey Park?
Yes, it is. I'm going to Monterey Park, too.
Thank you. I was just making sure. I'm new to the area.
I've lived in this area for a while.
I'm visiting friends. If you don't mind me asking, what are you going to do?
I'm going to visit the markets and stores there.
Nice. Do you recommend any restaurants in Monterey Park?
You should try the Elite Restaurant. It's pretty good.
I'll be sure to check it out. Here comes our stop. Have a nice day.
Nice talking to you.

title: The Bus System (1)
content: I have to go to Downtown Los Angeles today.
What for? Are you visiting someone?
No, I have an important job interview there.
How are you planning on getting there?
I would drive. but my car overheated last night.
It looks like you're going to have to ride the bus.
I haven't ridden the bus in years.
I can help you out if you want.
That would be great! What could you tell me about the bus system in Los Angeles?
Speaking from experience, I could tell you how efficient it is.
Do you take the bus to Los Angeles frequently?
Only every week, Monday through Friday for the past two years.

title: The Bus System (2)
content: I want to get to Monterey Park. What bus should I take?
If you're in Maywood, you can take the 260 bus on Atlantic.
How long will it take me to get there?
It will take you about thirty minutes depending on traffic.
That's not too bad.
Yeah, it really isn't.
Are there a lot of people on that bus?
The 260 bus can get pretty full except on holidays.
Thank you for telling me.
No problem. Where are you going?
I'll be visiting friends.
That's nice. I hope you have fun.

title: Why to Buy a Pass (1)
content: How much does it cost to ride the bus?
The cost is one dollar and fifty cents.
I'm going to have to spend nearly ten dollars today on just bus fare alone.
Why do you say that?
I have to take six buses in total today.
Why so many?
Three buses to get to where I'm going and three to get back home.
You should just buy a pass for the day.
A pass? What's that?
It's literally a pass that allows you to ride any bus for free.
Wow, that sounds like a good reason to buy one.
You definitely should. You'd save money in the long run.

title: Why to Buy a Pass (2)
content: I'm going to commute to school by bus this year.
You should consider getting a bus pass.
Why should I buy a bus pass?
It's cheaper compared to manually paying every day.
What kind of pass do you recommend I get?
You should get the monthly pass.
How much is a monthly pass?
It is $64, but because you're a student, you can get a student discount.
How much will it be with a student discount?
It will be 35 dollars.
Wow, that is cheap.
You'll need your student ID.

title: Where to Buy a Pass (1)
content: I need to buy a bus pass.
Where do you need to go?
I have to go to the Los Angeles Library.
You need to buy a buss pass, that's for sure.
I don't know where to buy it.
You've never purchased a bus pass?
I wouldn't be asking if I did.
It's easy to buy a bus pass. All you have to do is get on the bus and ask for one.
It's that easy? Are you sure?
Don't you believe me?
I do, but I thought it would be more complicated than that.
There are other places where you can buy them.
I think I'll just buy the pass on the bus.
Alright, suit yourself. And you're welcome.

title: Where to Buy a Pass (2)
content: Excuse me. May I ask you a question?
Sure. What do you need to know?
Do you know where I can purchase a bus pass?
Yes I do. There are several places where you can purchase them.
Could you please tell me where?
There is one on Norwalk, one in Long beach, and one in Santa Clarita.
Do you know how to get to the one located on Norwalk?
Here is a list of directions you can have.
Can I keep it?
Yes. You can keep it.
Thank you very much. This is very helpful.
No problem. I'm glad I could help.

title: Where to Take the Bus (1)
content: Excuse me. Can I have a minute of your time, please?
Sure, what is it?
I'm trying to take the bus to Downey, but I don't know where to take the bus.
Downey? Let me think. Are you visiting relatives there?
My girlfriend actually is the one I'm going to visit.
That's sweet. I'm sorry, small talk helps me remember.
In that case, let me ask where are you going?
I'm going to work. I take the bus there every day.
You must save plenty of money on gas and insurance.
Yup, I sure do. Wait, now I remember which bus takes you to Downey!
Can you tell me where to take it?
Sure. You need to take it on Florence Avenue in the city of Bell.

title: Where to Take the Bus (2)
content: Do you know how I can get to the Gold Line?
Yes I do. You'll only need one bus.
Which bus should I take?
You can take the 260 bus on Atlantic.
How long will it take me to get there?
It should take you no longer than 30 minutes depending on traffic.
Thanks. I'll leave in a bit.
Where are you planning to go?
I want to go to Little Tokyo. I heard nice things about it.
Can I go with you?
Sure! You can then show me where the 260 stop is.
Awesome! I'll just grab my bus pass. Then I'll be ready to go.

title: Where to Change the Bus (1)
content: You seem a little lost. Can I be of some assistance?
That would be nice of you. I just have one question.
You can ask as many as you want.
I just need to know where to change buses.
Well, where are you going? I need to know that.
I'm going to Beverly Hills.
In that case, you need to change buses in a few minutes.
What bus do I need to change to?
You're going to get off this one and get on Line 720.
That bus takes me to Beverly Hills?
Yes, right in the center of it.
Where do I change into the 720 bus?
You're going to change on Whittier Avenue.
Thank you, sir. You have been so helpful.

title: Where to Change the Bus (2)
content: Do you know which bus will get me from Maywood to Cal State LA?
Yes, I do. You'll need to take two buses.
Which bus should I take first?
You'll need to take the 260 on Atlantic all the way to Garvey.
Which bus do I take after that?
You'll have to take the 70 bus.
Will I find the 70 bus stop immediately?
Yes. You'll find it right across the street after you get off the 260.
How long might the whole trip take?
It might take you about 40 minutes to an hour depending on traffic.
Alright. Thank you very much.
You're welcome. Glad I could help.

title: Looking for a Job
content: Hey Dennis, this is Ron. How's it going?
Hi, Ron. I'm looking for a summer job. I was hoping you could help me.
Okay, how can I help you?
Well, I was wondering if you could hook me up at the place you work.
No problem. I don't know if they're hiring, but I'll find out.
Aw man, you're the bomb!
What kind of job you are interested in doing?
Anything you think that I can do will be fine.
I'll talk to my boss in the morning and get back to you.
Thanks, man. A friend in need is a friend indeed.
Anything else you need me to do?
No. I'm waiting to hear from you.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (1)
content: Okay, I talked to my boss. Here's his phone number.
Thanks a lot, bud. Did he say he has an open position?
No, but he said he would talk to you.
That's great! Hey, thanks again.
You know, you should also go online to look for work
Online? Where?
There are many job search websites.
Do you know any by name?
Just Google "Jobs in L.A." and you'll find some.
Okay, I'll try that when I get home.
You can do it on your smartphone, you know.
I know, but I think it's better at home, thanks again.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (2)
content: I am so excited. I've got my first job interview.
Interview for what?
It's an engineering internship for the city of L.A.
Wow, that's impressive.
I'm preparing for the interview by practicing with my sister.
What exactly are you doing?
We're doing mock interviews.
Is that helpful?
It sure is. She recorded our first interview, and pointed out things I should avoid.
What are some of the things she saw?
She said that I said,"You know" too much, and that I looked nervous.
Cool! That should help.
It has. I feel so confident now.
Well, good luck, my friend.

title: Greeted by Receptionist
content: Good morning. Welcome to ABC Technologies.
Hi, good morning.
How can I help you?
I have an appointment with Mr. Rogers today.
Oh, what time is that? I don't see it on his schedule.
Well, there's no set time. I'm an old friend of his.
Okay, let me call him. What is your name?
I'm Tom Williams. He will know me.
Just a minute, sir. Please take a seat.
Thank you.
Yes, Mr. Williams. Mr. Rogers will see you soon.
That's wonderful. I know how busy he is. Thanks.

title: Job Interview (1)
content: Good morning. My name is Robert Stevens.
Good morning, Mr. Stevens. My name is Richard Jones.
Please have a seat, and let's get started.
Thank you, Mr. Stevens.
Please call me Robert, and I'll call you Richard. We are informal here.
That's good to know, Robert. Thanks.
I see you have two years experience. Can you tell me a little about that?
Oh, yes. I worked in the mailroom at Acme Corporation last year.
Go on, please.
It was a temporary job, but I gained a lot of experience.
Excellent! We are always looking for someone with experience.
I think this experience will help me blend into a job working here.

title: Job Interview (2)
content: Hello, my name is Angela Davis.
Good morning, Angela. I am Dick Williams. I'll be interviewing you today.
Good morning, Mr. Williams.
So, what do you know about our company, Angela?
Well, I did a little Internet research last night, and I know the company is growing.
Excellent! What else?
I learned the company is a leading seller of office technology equipment.
That's good, Angela. I'm happy to see you taking the time to do research.
Thank you, Mr. Williams.
I am going to recommend you for the job.
Thanks again.
Someone will contact you soon. Congratulations!

title: Asking questions at an Interview
content: That concludes my part of the interview. Do you have any questions for me?
Yes, thank you, Mr. Thompson, I do.
Okay, what's on your mind?
Is this a new position?
Yes, we have created this new position recently.
If you hire me, when do you want me to start?
We plan to hire someone by the end of this month.
Are there some times of the year that are busier than others?
Yes. The summer months are very busy here.
That's good to know. Does it matter if I take night classes?
No. The hours for the job are in the daytime.
Okay, I have no more questions. Thank you.

title: Accepting a Job Offer
content: Hello, may I speak to Susan, please?
Yes, this is Susan.
This is Mr. Jones from the ABC Company.
Hello, Mr. Jones.
I have a job offer if you are still interested.
Oh, that's wonderful. Is it for the customer service job?
Yes, we would like you to start next Monday. It pays $15 per hour.
Next Monday? Sure. I'll take it.
Super. I'll email you some literature you can read about our company.
Oh, that's great news, Mr. Jones.
Welcome to the ABC Company. We'll see you Monday.
Okay, Monday it is. See you then.

title: Talking on the Phone
content: Hello.
Hi, baby, it's Joe.
What's up, honey?
I just got off work. What are you doing tonight?
I don't have any plans. I'll be getting home at about 6:00.
Well, I got a hold of some Dodger tickets for tonight.
How did you manage that?
A friend at work was selling them. He couldn't go himself.
That's great! Who are they playing?
They're playing the Giants. It should be a good game.
Alright then, count me in.
Okay, I'll pick you up at 6:30.

title: Request for Office Supplies
content: Hey Alice, do you have a stapler I can use?
Of course I do. It's on my desk.
Thanks. Mine broke two weeks ago.
Didn't you put in a office supply request?
I asked Joseph if he would get me one.
I know he's in charge, but you should submit a form.
A form? What form?
An Office Supply form. Don't rely on Joseph. Put it in writing.
Oh, I could use a couple of other supplies, too.
Yes, by all means, get what you need.
Where are these forms?
I'll email it to you. Just print it, and send it in.
Thanks, Alice.
No problem.

title: Offering Help
content: Hi, Michelle. What are you up to?
I'm looking for work online.
Cool! What kind of job are you looking for?
I need a part-time job, but I'm not doing too well.
I'm pretty good at this. Can I help?
You sure can.
Okay, let's see. You can narrow your search on this site.
How can I do that?
Go to the "Advanced Search" button and click on it.
I see it. Okay, now what?
There are many options. You can search by city, by job, or pay.
I see. Let me try searching by city. Thanks.

title: Asking for Help
content: Hello, my name is Sally. I am hoping you could help me.
Of course I can, that's what I'm here for.
I want to look for a job, but I don't have Internet access at home.
That's okay, let's get started.
Great! What do I do first?
You're going to need an email address. Do you have one?
Yes, I have my own email.
Okay, I can show you a couple of good websites for jobs.
That would be awesome! Thanks.
We also have job bulletins on that table over there. You can search through those, too.
Well, thank you, miss. I greatly appreciate your help.
No problem. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask.

title: Responding to a Plea for Help
content: Hey, Richard, I could sure use your help.
What is it, Jerry?
I can't seem to land an interview.
Have you applied to many places?
Yes I have. I've sent out about 50 resumes.
Did you include cover letters?
On some I did, others, no.
Well, that may be your problem. You should always include a cover letter.
Really? Why?
It shows you took the time to research the company. HR people like that.
Okay, I will. Thanks.
You're welcome. I think you will see more interest in your resume now.

title: How to Do a Timesheet
content: This is the first time I've ever had to do a timesheet.
Well, they're very easy to do.
You've done this before. Maybe you can help me.
Sure, I can help.
What do I need?
You'll need your employee number.
Okay, I'll look it up.
Once you have that, all you need to do is log your hours.
I have a good idea what hours I worked this week.
You need to be accurate.
It will be pretty close.
It must be exact. You don't want to cheat the company, or yourself.

title: Making a Phone Call
content: Hi! How are you?
I'm doing good. How are you?
I'm great, but a little nervous.
Why is that?
I have a phone interview for a job in an hour.
A phone interview? That's great!
It is, but I'm convinced I'm going to mess it up.
Oh, you shouldn't say that. You'll be fine.
I wish I had your confidence.
Just relax, and be yourself. A phone interview is easier than in person.
That's right. I wasn't looking at it that way.
Be yourself. Don't pretend to be anyone else, and you'll do well.

title: Schedule an Appointment for a Meeting
content: Good morning, Jet Office Products.
Hello, my name is Richard Lee, and I would like to make an appointment.
Good morning, Mr. Lee. My name is Sheila.
Hello, Sheila. I was asked by Mrs. Roberts to schedule a meeting with her.
Is this for an interview?
No, I've already interviewed with her.
Oh, I see. It's for a follow-up meeting. When are you free?
My schedule is fairly open. When will she be available?
How about Tuesday at 9 a.m.?
This Tuesday, the 5th?
Yes, that's correct.
That will be fine. I'll be there. Thanks.

title: Rearranging an Appointment
content: Good afternoon. Jet Office Products.
Hello, my name is Richard Lee. I need to reschedule an appointment.
I could help you with that.
I have an appointment for 9 a.m. Tuesday that I need to change.
Who was your appointment with?
I was scheduled to see Mrs. Roberts.
Okay. Thank you for calling.
You're welcome. Can I reschedule?
Yes, of course. When will you be free?
Does Mrs. Roberts have any time on Wednesday?
No, but she's free Thursday afternoon at 1:00 p.m.
That's perfect. Thank you. I'll see her then.

title: Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
content: Good morning, Peterson Industries.
Hello, Betty. This is Roger.
Hey, Roger. Where are you?
I am stuck on the 60 freeway. I'm going to be late for work.
Oh, no. Any traffic accident happened?
I really don't know, Betty. All I know is that traffic is crawling.
I will tell your supervisor you called in late.
That would be great, but I could tell him myself.
Well, normally that would be okay, but he's stuck in the same traffic jam.
Oh no! Really? Okay.
At least he'll know your excuse is true!
Yes. Thank you. See you soon.

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
content: Please have a seat.
Thank you.
I am very disappointed in you.
I know. Believe me, I tried very hard to make your deadline.
I was depending on that report.
I know, but unexpected circumstances came up.
Unexpected circumstances?
Yes. I would have had it ready in time, but the computer crashed.
The company computer crashed?
Yes, it did. I had weeks of saved work on it when it crashed.
So your report was ready?
Yes, it was. The crash deleted all my work.
Okay, I'll check with IT. Thanks.
You're welcome.

title: Asking for a Description of a Person
content: Hi! How are you?
I'm doing good. Hey, did you apply for the job?
I sure did. I'm meeting your boss today.
Today, but it's Saturday.
I know. I'm meeting with him at a restaurant later.
That's cool. He must be very interested.
Can you describe him?
Sure. He's a tall Asian, who is a bit overweight with long black hair.
Well, that helps. This is the first time I will see him.
He's really friendly, and he always wears a tie.
Okay, thanks. That helps.
No problem, my friend. Good luck on your interview.

title: Asking for Permission
content: Hello, this is my first time here. I could use some help.
Okay, I can help. What is it you want to do?
I need to use the database on your computer.
Well, I need something from you before I can allow you to do that.
What do you need from me?
I will need you to fill out this form, and show me identification.
Okay, I'll do that. I can then search your database?
Oh, no. You'll need to ask for permission.
Here's the form and my ID.
Wonderful. You can ask Mr. Lee for permission now.
That's super. Thanks.
You're welcome. Good luck.

title: Express Agreement
content: how's it going?
Same old stuff. What's up?
I'm working on this project. Can you look at it?
Yeah, I'll take a look at it. What is it supposed to be?
It's a presentation on how to increase productivity.
Really? This is your project?
Yes. I came up with an idea, and my boss wants to see it.
That's awesome. Let's see it.
Well, that's it. What do you think?
I really liked the graphics. I think it's a winner.
That's great. I am really nervous.
Don't be. It is very professional, and it's a great idea.

title: Express Disagreement
content: Hey! Are you busy?
Not at the moment. What's going on?
I wanted to run something by you. It's an idea for work.
Okay, shoot.
Well, I'm thinking of asking my boss to change the work schedule.
Why? What's your idea?
It's to change from five, eight-hour days, to four, ten-hour days.
Wow. That's a big change. I don't think he'll go for it.
It's still 40 hours per week, and everyone will get an extra day off.
I don't think it will work. It's not a good idea.
Why is it not a good idea?
Companies should be open five days a week. Sorry, I don't like it.

title: Express Certainty
content: I just read your proposal.
What did you think about it?
You definitely have some good ideas.
Well, I worked on it very hard.
I'm concerned about the cost, though.
I thought you might be. Here's a cost analysis I ran.
It says here that your proposal will pay for itself in a year.
That's what I put in the report.
That's impressive. If this is true, I'm certain this can work.
I'm quite sure it will work.
You have done a good job. We'll discuss this at our next meeting.
I appreciate your confidence in me.

title: Express Uncertainty
content: How are you?
I'm doing well. How are you?
I'm fine, thanks. I was wondering if you read my report.
Yes, I did read your report.
Well, what did you think?
To be truthful, I didn't like it much.
Oh, no. Why not?
I don't have the time to discuss this now. Let's make an appointment.
Okay, but generally speaking, what was wrong with it?
I just don't feel confident in it.
I can make it work. All I need is time.
I like your enthusiasm, but it's too risky, sorry.

title: Express Likes
content: Hello, my name is George. What's your name?
Hi George, I'm Christine. Nice to meet you.
Hi Christine. Have you worked here long?
Almost two years now, and you?
This is my first week. I really like it so far.
Yes, it's a good place to work.
I like how it seems so organized.
That's one of the things I like best, too.
The benefits aren't bad, either.
No, they're not. I especially like the health plan.
That's great. I'll be eligible in July for that.
You're going to like it here. This is the best place I've worked.

title: Express Dislikes
content: Oh, I am so tired.
I know what you mean.
I don't know if I can continue working like this.
I know. I've been doing it a lot longer than you.
Isn't there something we can do?
I have complained about the double shifts before.
What has management told you?
They said they are hiring more people, and that this is temporary.
I need this job, but I don't like these hours at all.
Just hang in there. I'm sure it will change.
It'd better change, and the sooner the better.
You're right. People may start leaving.

title: Making Promises
content: I know a lot of you have been working double shifts lately.
Yes, we have.
I am pleased to say that we have hired some help.
Alright! That's great. When do they start?
One person will start next week. The others will follow.
Only one? You promised more help last week.
I know I did, but the search has taken longer than I thought.
Oh, no. That's terrible.
Don't worry. I promise you all, I'll get some help.
Okay, thanks. These 16-hour days are killing us.
Help is on the way. I promise.
That's good enough for us.

title: Unemployment Insurance
content: Hey Diana, why so glum?
Aw Bobby, I just lost my job.
Oh, no. What happened?
The company is relocating to another state.
That's tough, Diana. What are you going to do now?
I'm looking for a new job. I need to pay my bills.
Are you filing for unemployment benefits?
I don't think I'm eligible. I only worked there three months.
Sure, you're eligible. You worked long enough.
I didn't know that.
I think you only have to work for two weeks to be eligible.
That's great. I hope I can get it.
You'll never know untill you try.
Thanks, Bobby. You're a good friend.

title: Calling EDD to Report Unemployment
content: Good Morning! EDD, how can I help you?
Hello, I recently lost my job. Can I file for unemployment?
Yes, you certainly can.
How do I file a claim?
The easiest way is to go online.
All right, I will. What's the website.
Just do a search for "EDD" and you will see the site.
I will, but what if I need help?
There's online help, but if you still need help, call back.
Okay, I will. Thank you.

title: How to Collect Unemployment Benefits
content: Hello. What are you doing here?
Hi! I lost my job, so here I am at the EDD.
That's rough. I lost my job three months ago.
I didn't know that. Maybe you can help me apply.
Sure, I can help. You just need some basic information about your job history.
I have that information for the company I last worked for.
They ask for information on all places you worked for the last 18 months.
I can get that. What else do they ask?
Name, residence, addresses, that kind of stuff, and most importantly, why you're not working.
You mean if I quit, or was fired.
Yes, and be truthful. They will call your former employers.
Thanks. That helps a lot.

title: Questions about the Forms
content: Do you know what forms I need to file an unemployment claim?
You can go to an EDD office or fill out a form on their website to open a claim.
Is it really that simple?
It sure is. It is easier to do online.
Why would I want to do it online?
It's faster, and you can do it from home, or wherever you have Internet access.
Do you know the website?
Yes, it's edd.ca.gov. It's easy to use.
Then what do I do?
You will have to find a link that says "Apply Here", and click on it.
Is that all there is to it?
That's it. You're good to go.

title: At the EDD Office
content: Good morning. How can I help you?
Good morning to you. Yes. I'd like to file a claim.
Okay, I can help you with that.
All right. What do I need to do?
The easiest way to file a claim is online. You can use our computers for that.
That's wonderful. Do I need to log in?
No, you don't. Our computers are connected directly to the EDD.
But I don't know if I'm eligible for benefits.
The EDD will make that decision. Just fill in the forms as best you can.
Thank you. I'll use the computer here to file the claim right away.
If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask.
All right. I will. Thanks once again.

title: Payment not Received
content: Did you bring the mail in today?
Yeah. I got it right here.
Oh, great. I'm waiting for my unemployment check. It's late.
Sorry to tell you, your payment didn't come today.
No way. Darn it! It's more than a week late!
Why don't you call EDD? I think they can tell you where it is.
I definitely need to call them.
I think it's an automated system.
Oh darn. I don't like automated systems.
The EDD system is not so bad.
Okay, I'll call. This is the longest the check has taken to get to me.
If you have problems with the system, you can speak to a person by dialing "0".

title: Reduced Payments
content: I just got off the phone with the EDD.
What did they say? Are you going to get benefits?
Yes, but not as much as I thought.
What do you mean?
I thought I would receive a certain amount per month, but I got less.
Why is that?
I'm not really sure. It has something to do with how much I earned.
They pay benefits based on your income?
Yes. I think the more you earn, the more you receive.
That's interesting. I didn't know that.
I think I may go to the EDD office to ask about it.
You should go. What have you got to lose?

title: Looking for Jobs at EDD
content: How are you doing?
Good! What's going on?
Not too much. I'm on my way to the EDD.
Wait a minute. I thought you found a job last month.
I did. I'm not going there to file a claim.
Then why are you heading out there?
The EDD is hiring, that's why.
Wow! That's awesome. That's a very good place to work.
I know. That's why I'm going.
The pay is good, and the benefits are excellent.
Yes, my sister works there.
Good luck to you. I may have to go there myself now.

title: Talking to People at EDD
content: Hello, my name is George.
Hello, George. How can I help you?
I'm trying to file a claim online, but I have questions.
Okay, give me a moment and I'll go over there to help you.
Hello again. Thanks for coming over.
It's my pleasure. What are you having trouble with?
It's this question here. I'm not sure what it is asking for.
The system is asking for the reason you are no longer working.
Does that make a difference?
Yes it does. We review every person's case individually.
My company went out of business.
Then just put "Company out of business." You should be okay.

title: Attending a Workshop at EDD
content: Good morning. How are you today?
I'm doing well. Thank you.
Are you here for our workshop today?
Yes, as a matter of fact, I am.
That's wonderful. This will help quite a bit.
Will you be giving the workshop?
Yes I will, with a couple of my colleagues.
How many people are you expecting?
Not many, unfortunately.
What do you mean?
Everyone should attend if possible. This makes filing so easy.
I'll tell my friend Joseph. He's coming tomorrow.

title: How to prepare for an Interview
content: I was hoping you could help me.
I'll try. What help do you need?
I'm having an interview tomorrow morning. I'm very nervous.
That's great! Why are you nervous though?
I don't do well in interviews.
They can be frightening, but you can do it.
I'm afraid they'll ask me something I won't know.
You should prepare yourself. Go online, and look at their website.
Now why didn't I think of that?
It's a good idea to know everything you can about them first.
That's an excellent idea! Thanks.
You're welcome. If you need more help, give me a call.

title: Election Day
content: Are you voting?
Is Election Day coming up?
It is. Election day is the first Tuesday in November.
I'm not sure if I'm even registered.
Did you fill out a registration form?
I did, and I think I got a card in the mail.
That's your voter card. So you are all set.
Are you going to vote?
I am going to vote. Why don't we go together?
That's a great idea. I still need to decide who I'm voting for.
I received so many mailings from all the candidates.
I'm going to go to your house and read them to help me decide.

title: Election System
content: Election Day is next Tuesday.
Did you register to vote?
How do you register?
If you are a U.S. citizen, 18 years or older, you can fill out a form.
What does the form ask you?
It asks for basic details like your name, address, age, and what political party you want to join.
Do I have to choose a political party?
No, that's optional, but if you choose a party, you can vote in certain primaries.
What happens once I register?
You'll get a voter card in the mail.
What good is that?
It will tell you where your polling place is.

title: Polling Place
content: Tomorrow's Election Day, but I don't know where I'm supposed to go vote.
You didn't get a card in the mail telling you where you polling place is?
I think I threw it away. Can't I just go with you?
No. Everyone's polling place is different based on your address.
So how do I know where to go now?
You can check the Board of Elections website.
What if I don't have Internet access?
There's also a phone number you can call.
Where is your polling place?
My polling place is at the recreation center a block away from my house.
Will my polling place be close to where I live?
It should be within walking distance.

title: Absentee Ballot
content: I don't think I'll be in town on Election Day.
You can still vote though.
How can I vote if I won't be here?
You can file an absentee ballot.
How do I do that?
You can ask for a mail-in ballot.
What is that?
It's a form you mail in saying who you want to vote for.
Does it count like a regular ballot?
It's just as if you were voting in person.
I'd better ask for one then.
You should do it quickly since it has to be in a week before Election Day.

title: Speaking Negatively about the Candidate
content: Are you voting for the same mayoral candidate I am voting for?
There is no way I'm voting for your guy.
Why are you saying that?
Are you kidding? Have you heard him speak?
What do you mean?
I don't agree with his positions.
I think he has a great education plan.
He's going to ruin our schools with his plan.
Come on! How about his jobs plan?
That's even worse than his education plan.
I think you need to give the guy a chance.
The candidate I'm choosing is way better than your guy.

title: Speaking Positively about the Candidate
content: I'm really looking forward to casting my vote today.
Oh really? Why?
I think my candidate will really change the way things are done in our city.
How is that?
Her education policy will help all students.
I'll have to review her policy plan before I vote.
You really should. You're a parent.
What else do you like about the candidate?
Her economic policy will lower the unemployment rate in the city.
I've been unemployed for a while.
Then you should vote for her.
I'll read up on her positions.

title: Fundraising for Campaigns
content: Would you be interested in donating to our candidate's campaign today?
Maybe. Can you tell me more about why you are raising money?
Sure! Campaign ads are expensive, so we want to raise money for TV ads.
Some of those ads are so negative though.
You're right, but the new ads are going to be positive.
How much money are you trying to raise?
We need a few thousand dollars
Is this the only way you are raising money?
No. We are doing phone banking and even having an event.
What kind of event?
We are hosting a lunch with the candidate.
I may be interested in donating for that.

title: Volunteering for Campaigns
content: I wonder what I can do to get involved in the campaign?
You can volunteer.
What does a campaign volunteer do?
All kinds of things like handing out pamphlets.
Pamphlets about what?
About the candidate and what they stand for.
That sounds like it would be a great way to meet people.
It is. Volunteers also make phone calls and ask for money.
I would feel awkward asking strangers for money.
It's not for you. It's for your candidate.
You have a point.
Volunteering for a campaign is a great experience.

title: Working at the Polling Place
content: I'm really excited about my short-term job.
What's so great about it?
I'll be working at a polling place.
What do you do at that job?
I'll help to make sure voters are voting at the right place and answer basic questions.
Was the job hard to get?
Not really. I filled out an application online.
That's all you had to do?
There was a mandatory training too, but they paid me for that.
Does it pay well?
It pays better than the minimum wage.
Maybe I'll become a poll worker, too.

title: Asking Questions at the Polling Place
content: This is my first time voting and I need some help.
I'll be happy to help you. What's your name and address?
Here's my identification.
You are in the right place.
How do you know?
Your name is right here. Sign next to the image of your signature.
Okay, sign here. Then what?
Then you are ready to vote.
Where do I do that?
You can use that empty booth right behind you.
You are so helpful.
I'm just doing my job as a poll worker.

title: Meeting Candidate before Voting
content: I hope you are on your way to vote right now.
I am. And I'm actually voting for you!
Glad to hear that. I appreciate your vote.
Can I ask you a question?
That's why I'm out here today.
Do you really think you can change City Hall?
I am sure going to try.
See that's the reason why you have my vote.
Make sure you tell a friend to vote today.
Should I tell them to vote for you?
You don't have to, but it sure would be appreciated.
Every vote counts.

title: Interviewing a Voter
content: I work for the Big City Newspaper, and I'm doing a story on Election Day.
I read that paper all the time!
Great! So I can interview you for my story?
I would love that!
Did you vote today?
I'm on my way home from voting now.
Who did you vote for?
I voted for our city's first female mayor.
Were there many people voting?
I think turnout was pretty low. It's a shame.
Why do you think that is?
I think people think all politicians are dishonest.

title: Excitement after Voting
content: That was such a rush.
What did you do?
It was my first time voting in an election.
Oh wow! Congratulations, but why is that so exciting for you?
Are you kidding? I just played a role in history.
What if the incumbent wins?
Still, participating in U.S. democracy is great.
Maybe because I've done it so many times, and it doesn't seem like a big deal to me.
I can't wait to vote again next election.
Not everyone votes, so it's good that you take it seriously.
Everyone should take it seriously.
You're a great example.

title: Discussing Who You Voted for
content: So, who did you vote for?
I voted for De Blasio.
It's been a while since New York City had a Democrat as a mayor.
It has been too long.
You think so? I'm a Republican.
It's like Obama's campaign. Change is good.
I guess we'll have to wait for the results.
That's true.
May the best person win.
I hope it was my candidate.
What if De Blasio doesn't win?
It's only four years till the next election.

title: Disappointed at the Result
content: I'm really bummed that Di Blasio won the election.
Really? Why is that?
I think Republican mayors have been good for our city.
There's too much inequality.
You think this new mayor will change that?
You bet he will. It was his campaign promise.
Politicians make promises all the time. It doesn't mean anything.
I think you're wrong.
Mark my words. This will mean more crime.
Crime has been going down all over the country.
Thanks to the Democrats.
I guess we'll have to give the new mayor a chance.

title: Happy with the Result
content: Finally we'll have a Democratic mayor in New York City.
I don't even know what that is like.
Exactly! There hasn't been a Democrat running this city in a long time.
I hope he will live up to all his campaign promises.
He will. The mayor elect is really sincere.
They all seem sincere in the beginning.
This is really going to turn the city around.
How will that happen?
Are your kidding? There will be better schools.
The school system is pretty bad right now.
There will also be more affordable housing.
The city sure could use that.

title: Comments on the New President
content: Having a new president will change the course of history.
Why do you say that?
Well, Obama was our first black president. Now we have our first woman.
You think gender matters that much?
Absolutely! Women view things differently.
You don't think she'll be too soft on foreign policy?
No way! Look how she handled things as Secretary of State.
That's true. She was tough, but also sympathetic.
Exactly. We need someone who is more than just tough.
I worry about people being too tough on her.
She was a first lady so she knows the ins and outs.
She definitely has experience.

title: Going to an Open House
content: Hey Richard, are you busy today?
I have a couple of errands to run, but I should be done early.
If you have time this afternoon, do you want to go with me?
Sure! Where are you going?
I'm going to an open house in San Gabriel today.
I didn't know you were looking for a house.
I am not ready to buy today. I'm just checking the market out.
That's very smart.
I want to see what I can afford.
That makes total sense. Count me in.
Okay, then I'll pick you up at about 3 p.m. Is that okay?
Yes, I should be done by then. Thanks.

title: First Meeting with a Realtor
content: Good day! Thanks for meeting with me.
You're welcome, Ms. Thomas. Please sit down.
Thank you. Please call me Jane.
All right! Jane and you can call me Dave.
I am looking to buy a house for myself and my son.
Wonderful! Buying is always a good idea. Do you rent now?
I did, but for the last six-months, I've been living with my mother.
I see. Can I ask you what you do for a living?
I work for the city planning department.
That's a good job. How long have you worked there?
For about three years now.
All right. Let's get started. I'll see what we can do.

title: Pre-Qualifying for a Loan
content: The best way to buy a house is to get pre-qualified, Ms. Anderson.
Why is that, Mr. Williams?
By pre-qualifying, you know beforehand which house you can buy.
I thought I would look at houses first.
That's okay too, but you may be wasting your time.
How so, Mr. Williams?
You may find a house you really like, but can't afford it.
Well, that's when I'll negotiate with the seller.
Yes, that's true, but by pre-qualifying, you'll save time, and effort.
How is that?
You will be able to select a home you know you can afford.
Okay. Then we'll try it your way.

title: An Appointment to View Houses
content: Hello, this is Sam Jones.
Good morning, Mr. Jones. How can I help you?
I've been working with one of your realtors. I'd like to view some homes now.
Okay. Who have you been working with?
I've been working with Ms. Thomas.
Oh, she's an excellent realtor. I'll check her calendar.
Thank you. I'm very anxious to get started.
Are you free this Saturday?
I think so. What time?
She has time between 1 - 3 p.m. this Saturday, the 12th.
I think that will work. Let's do it.
I'll be sure to confirm with both of you on Friday. Have a good day.

title: Viewing Houses with a Realtor
content: Good evening. I'm glad you could make it.
I wouldn't miss this for the world.
Okay, let's get started.
Sounds fine. I'm glad we're starting here.
Yes, this is a great starter house, and it's in a good neighborhood.
Do you know anything about the schools?
This is part of an award-winning school district.
That's what I wanted to hear.
Let's take a look inside.
Okay, let's do it.
I figure we can view at least four homes today, maybe five.
That's wonderful. I'm so excited.

title: Do not Like the House (1)
content: I think this house will fill all you needs, Mr. Jones.
Well, I don't particularly like the neighborhood.
I understand your concern, Mr. Jones, but let's take a look inside.
Okay, but I'm really concerned about the neighborhood.
That's okay, Mr. Jones. We're not married to this home.
I guess we can look inside since we're here.
Great! Let's go inside. It's a beautiful home.
I don't like it already. The porch is too small. I have a big family.
All right, Mr. Jones. This may not be the right house for you.
That's what I've been trying to tell you.
That's okay. I've got more homes to show you.
That's good to hear.

title: Do not Like the House (2)
content: I hope this neighborhood is more to your liking.
Yes, it definitely is.
It's a little more money, but I think it's a great fit for you.
As long as I can afford it.
The porch is very large. I think your family will like it.
That's a good place to start.
This is the living area. As you can see, it's quite spacious.
Uh huh. I see.
And this is the master bedroom.
Sorry, it's a beautiful home, but it just doesn't feel right.
What's wrong, Mr. Jones?
It's the lighting, and it just doesn't feel right, sorry.

title: Find a House You Like
content: I'm sorry for being difficult.
Not at all. We aim to please.
It's just that this will be my family's home. It has to be right.
I understand completely.
So where is this next home?
It's nearby. I think this is the one.
I truly hope so.
This is it.
Wow! I like it.
I thought you might.
Is this in my price range? If it is, I think I just found my house.
It definitely is. Let's go inside.

title: Making an Offer through the Realtor
content: Good day, Ms. Andrews. Can we talk?
Of course, Mr. Johnson. Why don't you come into the office this afternoon?
That would be fine.
What's on your mind, Mr. Johnson?
I want to make an offer on the 1st Avenue home.
That's great. I'll see you at 2 p.m.
Hello, Ms. Andrews.
Hello, Mr. Johnson. You're right on time.
I like to be prompt, Ms. Andrews.
That's great. I appreciate that.
I'm ready to make an offer.
Okay, let's get started.

title: Discussing a Counter-Offer
content: Mr. Lee, the seller has made a counteroffer on his home.
He did not accept my original offer?
Technically he did, but he has conditions.
Okay, what are they?
He said your offer of $325,000 was a bit short.
What's his counteroffer?
He wants $335,000, and he'll throw in the appliances.
I don't know. Will the appliances have a warranty?
No. No warranty.
I'm going to have to think about this, Ms. Phillips.
Take your time. Counteroffers are common.
I need to talk to my wife about this. I'll get back to you.

title: Re-offering and Acceptance
content: Good morning, Ms. Phillips. I have a second counteroffer.
Okay, Mr. Lee. What is it?
I am willing to raise my offer to $330,000.
What about the appliances?
I'll take the appliances, but I want a limited warranty.
For how long?
I think six-months will suffice.
Well, I know this seller personally. I think we have a deal.
That's great. Are you certain?
I'm very sure. I'll confirm, of course. I think congratulations are in order.
I'll expect your call then. Thanks.

title: Discussing Home Inspection
content: This is Joseph Walters, the inspector.
Hello, Joseph. I'm the buyer, Mrs. Smith
Hello, Mrs. Smith. I've done a preliminary check of the property.
That's great! What did you find?
There are some issues with this home.
For instance?
Structurally, the house is sound.
That's a good start, Joseph.
The plumbing is substandard, the water heater is old, and the roof has issues.
You're kidding, right?
I wish I was. I'll know more in a couple of days.
Okay, keep me informed.

title: Signing Escrow Papers
content: It's time to go sign the escrow papers.
I'm on my way. Give me a minute.
Okay, we have some time.
I'm really excited about this. This is our first home.
I know. I'm also excited.
I'm just glad we came to an agreement with the buyer.
Me too. That negotiation was rough.
But the realtor told me it was common.
That may be true, but I didn't expect it.
That doesn't matter now. We got the house.
I know! When can we start moving in?
Soon, I hope. Really soon.

title: Details of Moving In
content: This is it. We can move in starting tomorrow.
No way! Really?
Yup. We cleared escrow. It's officially ours now.
I don't know what to say.
It's time to figure out how we're going to move in.
Well, I think we should rent a trailer, and move the big stuff first.
Yeah, that would make sense.
I'll start boxing everything else.
I know of a good moving company. My best friend used them last year.
Are they affordable?
I think so. I'll call them tomorrow morning.
I still can't believe that house is ours. It's a great feeling.

title: Ready To Sell the House
content: Now that we found our new home, it's time to sell our old one.
I know. It makes me sad.
Why is that, Dorothy?
I don't know. I guess it's because we've lived here so long.
I know, baby. But it's time to move on.
Yes, I know. The kids are all grown up now.
I'll contact our realtor tomorrow.
Are you going to use the same one?
No, I don't think so. I think I'll try someone new.
Why is that?
No reason, really. I just want to check around. We're in no hurry.
That's true. I'm good with that.

title: Marketing the House
content: It's time to start thinking about marketing our home.
Won't our realtor do that?
Yes, of course, but we can make some suggestions.
What suggestions?
I definitely want to have a "For Sale" sign on the lawn.
That's funny. Don't all houses for sale have that?
No, not really. A lot of homes are just listed on the Internet.
why do you want the sign then?
I still think it is an effective tool in selling a house.
Okay, you're the boss.
We'll also have a listing online, so we can reach more people.
Sounds good to me. We should do well then.

title: Setting an Asking Price
content: Hi Jennifer, it's Doug.
Hello, Doug. How can I help you?
I'm a bit concerned with how to set an asking price for my home.
Well, you shouldn't worry, Doug. We will set the price accordingly.
What do you mean?
We are experts at this. We'll take all factors into consideration.
Such as what, if I may ask?
Our formula takes local pricing, comparability, and market trends into consideration.
That's very thorough.
We are real estate experts, Doug.
I think I made the right decision to hire you, Ms. Winters.
Well, thank you, Doug. It's my pleasure.

title: Signing a Contract with a Realtor
content: Hello, Mr. Rogers. How are you today?
I'm doing well, Wendy. How are you?
I'm great, thanks. So are you ready to make a decision?
I certainly am. I'm going with your firm.
Oh, that's great news, Mr. Rogers.
Okay, so what's next?
I have a standard contract we use. You can look it over if you like.
Sure I will, but can you give me an overview?
It basically reads that you agree to have us act as your agent.
I still have the final say on the deal though, right?
Of course, you do, Mr. Rogers.
